original: 'on kyang mngon sum la sogs pa des kyang rang gi yul te /
analyzed: 'on kyang mngon sum la sogs pa des kyang rang gi yul te /
translated: But even perception and so on establish their objects,

original: bdag nyid dang rjes su mthun pa'i yul yang lung la ltos nas sgrub par byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid dang rjes su mthun pa'i yul yang lung la ltos nas sgrub par byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: and the object that is consistent with itself, in dependence on scripture.

original: de ltar na lung nyid gtso bo yin no zhes gzhan dag sems pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na lung nyid gtso bo yin no zhes gzhan dag sems pa'o //
translated: Thus, others think that scripture is primary.

original: du ba zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i yin te /
analyzed: du ba zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i yin te /
translated: The one who advocates the tenets says, ‚ÄúSmoke and so on.‚Äù

original: du ba la sogs pa'i rtags las me la sogs pa'i shes pa 'di la lung yong pa ma yin pas lung med pa can mi 'gyur na yang 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa'i rtags las me la sogs pa'i shes pa 'di la lung yong pa ma yin pas lung med pa can mi 'gyur na yang 'gyur ro ;
translated: The cognition of fire and so on from the evidence of smoke and so on is not based on scripture, so it is not without scripture.

original: / da bas na lung la ltos pa'i mngon sum la sogs pa rang gi lung la go bar byed pa ma yin no zhes bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: / da bas na lung la ltos pa'i mngon sum la sogs pa rang gi lung la go bar byed pa ma yin no zhes bsam par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should think that perception and so on that depend on scripture do not establish their own scripture.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi yin te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi yin te /
translated: The opponent says, ‚ÄúIf‚Äù and so on.

original: lung dpyod pa las dus phyis dbang po las 'das pa'i don la 'jug pa na mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma gzhan lung gi yul la tshol ba ma yin na /
analyzed: lung dpyod pa las dus phyis dbang po las 'das pa'i don la 'jug pa na mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma gzhan lung gi yul la tshol ba ma yin na /
translated: If, after investigating scripture, one later engages in the meaning of what is beyond the senses, then, if one does not seek another valid cognition such as perception, etc.,üîΩthen how could scripture alone be a means of valid cognition with regard to its own object?

original: gang gis de bas na yan gar ba la rtogs pa'i lung sgrub par byed pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i skyon 'dir 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis de bas na yan gar ba la rtogs pa'i lung sgrub par byed pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i skyon 'dir 'gyur /
translated: Thus, this fault would ensue.

original: rtogs pa'i phyir lung yan gar ba nyid rang gi yul la sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i phyir lung yan gar ba nyid rang gi yul la sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: But it is thought that scripture alone is a means of valid cognition with regard to its own object because it is understood.

original: 'on kyang lung dbang po las 'das pa'i don la 'jug pa de nyid ci 'di mi slu ba yin nam ma yin zhes mi shes so //
analyzed: 'on kyang lung dbang po las 'das pa'i don la 'jug pa de nyid ci 'di mi slu ba yin nam ma yin zhes mi shes so //
translated: However, one does not know whether that scripture which engages in the meaning of what is beyond the senses is non-deceptive or not.

original: nges na lung gi 'jug pa dpyod pa la tshad ma gzhan btsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: nges na lung gi 'jug pa dpyod pa la tshad ma gzhan btsal bar bya'o //
translated: If it is ascertained, then another means of valid cognition should be sought in the investigation of the engagement of scripture.

original: gal te lung 'jug pa na mngon sum la sogs pa dang bcas par 'gyur ba de ni rang gi yul la tshang ma yin par bsam par bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: gal te lung 'jug pa na mngon sum la sogs pa dang bcas par 'gyur ba de ni rang gi yul la tshang ma yin par bsam par bya'o snyam mo //
translated: If one thinks that when scripture engages, it is accompanied by perception, etc., then it should be considered a means of valid cognition with regard to its own object.

original: rab tu sgrub pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan yin no //
analyzed: rab tu sgrub pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan yin no //
translated: The response to that is stated beginning with ‚ÄúThe proof of the object beyond the senses.‚Äù

original: dbang po las 'das pa'i don rab tu sgrub pa de'i tshe mngon sum la sogs pa 'di'i bdag nyid nus pa lung nye ba na ste /
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa'i don rab tu sgrub pa de'i tshe mngon sum la sogs pa 'di'i bdag nyid nus pa lung nye ba na ste /
translated: When the object beyond the senses is proven, then the capacity of direct perception and so on is nearby, that is, close to scripture.

original: lung yang yin la de yang yin pa ste nye zhing thag nye bar mngon sum la sogs pa'i phul du byung ba ci zhig gso bar byed na /
analyzed: lung yang yin la de yang yin pa ste nye zhing thag nye bar mngon sum la sogs pa'i phul du byung ba ci zhig gso bar byed na /
translated: Since scripture is also that, that is, close to direct perception and so on, what need is there to rely on scripture?

original: gang gis lung gi 'jug pa rab tu bsgrubs nas dbang po las @48b 'das pa'i don rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis lung gi 'jug pa rab tu bsgrubs nas dbang po las @48b 'das pa'i don rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: By what means is the engagement of scripture proven, so that one can understand the object beyond the senses?

original: gal te dbang po la sogs pa las 'das pa'i don la yang mngon sum la sogs pa'i nus pa yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: gal te dbang po la sogs pa las 'das pa'i don la yang mngon sum la sogs pa'i nus pa yin pa de bas na /
translated: If the capacity of direct perception and so on is also in regard to the object beyond the senses, then

original: lung la ltos pa med par dbang po las 'das pa'i don bsgrub pa la lung ci zhig bya zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lung la ltos pa med par dbang po las 'das pa'i don bsgrub pa la lung ci zhig bya zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: what is the use of scripture in proving the object beyond the senses without relying on scripture? This is the meaning of the objection.

original: ci ste dbang po las 'das pa'i don la mngon sum la sogs pa nus pa med na ni nus pa med pa de nyid kyi phyir mngon sum la sogs pa lung 'jug tu zin kyang sgrub par byed pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste dbang po las 'das pa'i don la mngon sum la sogs pa nus pa med na ni nus pa med pa de nyid kyi phyir mngon sum la sogs pa lung 'jug tu zin kyang sgrub par byed pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if direct perception and so on are not capable of objects that are beyond the senses, then because they are incapable, they are not even established as proof, even though they are engaged in the scriptures.

original: ji ltar mtho ris la sogs pa dbang po las 'das pa mngon sum la sogs pas grub pa ma yin pa de ltar na dbang po las 'das pa'i don dang 'brel pa de yang de'i yul can zhes bya ba'i don lung gis 'jug pa dbang po las 'das
analyzed: ji ltar mtho ris la sogs pa dbang po las 'das pa mngon sum la sogs pas grub pa ma yin pa de ltar na dbang po las 'das pa'i don dang 'brel pa de yang de'i yul can zhes bya ba'i don lung gis 'jug pa dbang po las 'das
translated: Just as heaven and so on are not established by direct perception and so on, so too that which is related to an object beyond the senses is not established by another direct perception and so on, which is called ‚Äúthe object of that.‚Äù

original: par ji ltar mngon sum la sogs pa gzhan gyis grub pa yin te /
analyzed: par ji ltar mngon sum la sogs pa gzhan gyis grub pa yin te /
translated: How is it established by another direct perception and so on?

original: ma grub pa nyid yin na gang gis de'i don mngon sum la sogs pa tshol ba gang yin pa de ni cir yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: ma grub pa nyid yin na gang gis de'i don mngon sum la sogs pa tshol ba gang yin pa de ni cir yang mi rung ngo //
translated: If it is not established, then it is not suitable for anything to seek the object of that by means of direct perception and so on.

original: 'chad pa po mang po dag yod na yang mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma ston par byed pa gang yin pa de'i bshad pa gzung bar bya'o zhes brjod pa na lung gi mtshan nyid skyes bus ma byas pa nyid kyi phyir gzhan yang de bzhin du lung
analyzed: 'chad pa po mang po dag yod na yang mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma ston par byed pa gang yin pa de'i bshad pa gzung bar bya'o zhes brjod pa na lung gi mtshan nyid skyes bus ma byas pa nyid kyi phyir gzhan yang de bzhin du lung
translated: If there are many expounders, then one should accept the explanation of whoever demonstrates valid cognitions such as direct perception.

original: gi mtshan nyid skyes bus ma byas pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gi mtshan nyid skyes bus ma byas pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: When this is said, the definition of scripture is that it is not produced by a person.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says, ‚ÄúThus, etc.‚Äù

original: skyes bu gang gi tshig ni tshad ma yis //
analyzed: skyes bu gang gi tshig ni tshad ma yis //
translated: The words of a person are validüîΩbecause they are not deceptive.

original: mi slu ba can des byas tshig / skyes bu des legs par sbyar ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: mi slu ba can des byas tshig / skyes bu des legs par sbyar ba'i tshig go //
translated: The words of a person are well-formed words.

original: de lung zhes thog tshig legs par sbyar ba de'i don tshad mas gzung ba nyid du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de lung zhes thog tshig legs par sbyar ba de'i don tshad mas gzung ba nyid du bstan pa'o //

original: lung gi mtshan nyid gzhan de dag 'di yin pa de ltar na lung gi mtshan nyid skyes bus byas pa ni don med pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lung gi mtshan nyid gzhan de dag 'di yin pa de ltar na lung gi mtshan nyid skyes bus byas pa ni don med pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since those are the other definitions of scripture, the definition of scripture as produced by a person is meaningless.

original: lung smra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: lung smra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: The one who speaks of scripture and so on explains this.

original: skyes bu'i tshig tshad mas mi slu ba can du brtags pa'i don gang yin pa dang cig shos kyis brtags pa'i don de dag lung smra ba mtshungs pa na yang ste /
analyzed: skyes bu'i tshig tshad mas mi slu ba can du brtags pa'i don gang yin pa dang cig shos kyis brtags pa'i don de dag lung smra ba mtshungs pa na yang ste /
translated: When the meaning that is ascertained by the valid cognition of a person is the same as the meaning ascertained by the other,

analyzed: lung gi sgo nas 'chad pa po dag gis mtshungs par gsal bar byas su zin nas kyang tshad ma'i stobs kyis lung gi tshad mas mi slu ba'i don la lar lung nyid yin par 'dod pa na'o // tshad mas mi slu ba me la sbyin sreg ces bya ba'i tshig lung gi mtshan nyid yin par 'gyur na /
translated: even though the expounders of scripture have clarified the meaning equally through scripture, in some cases scripture is accepted as valid cognition, and in some cases it is not.üîΩIf the meaning of the words of scripture, such as ‚Äúfire is to be offered,‚Äù is valid cognition, then the definition of scripture would be ‚Äúthat which is not deceptive by the power of valid cognition.‚ÄùüîΩBut if the meaning of the words of scripture, such as ‚Äúfire is to be offered,‚Äù is not valid cognition, then the definition of scripture would be ‚Äúthat which is not produced by a person.‚Äù

original: skyes bus ma byas pa ste skyes bus byas pa ma yin pa ni lung gi mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa ste skyes bus byas pa ma yin pa ni lung gi mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it would not be the definition of scripture.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: @49a * // skyes bus ma byas pa mngon par 'dod pa ma yin pa skyes bus bstan pa'i don thams cad la mtshungs pa nyid yin na yang rtogs pa tshad mas gnod pa med pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @49a * // skyes bus ma byas pa mngon par 'dod pa ma yin pa skyes bus bstan pa'i don thams cad la mtshungs pa nyid yin na yang rtogs pa tshad mas gnod pa med pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though all objects taught by persons are the same in not being accepted as being created by persons, still, because the object is not undermined by valid knowledge,

analyzed: don gang la slu ba med pa'i tshad ma gzhan khas len par byed pa de bas na lung de la rtogs par 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: de yod na ste skyes bu ma byas pa nyid du yod par mtshungs na yang gzhan du tshad ma gzhan gyis mi slu ba'i don la ni lung ni go bar byed pa nyid du mi 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod na ste skyes bu ma byas pa nyid du yod par mtshungs na yang gzhan du tshad ma gzhan gyis mi slu ba'i don la ni lung ni go bar byed pa nyid du mi 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Even though it is the same in existing without being created by a person, still, because one does not accept that scripture as being a means of understanding other objects that are not undeceiving with regard to other valid knowledge,

original: gal te shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i don la lung ni tshad ma gzhan gyis mi slu ba la ltos pa de'i tshe shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i don la lung ltos pa med pa'i shes pa 'jug par 'dod pa de ltar na skyes bu'i phul du byungüîΩba khas blangs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩgal te shin tu lkog gyur don //üîΩmtho ris la sogs pa la lung med shes pa la yod na ni lung la ltos pa med pa'i shes pa yod na ste /

translated: If a consciousness that does not rely on scripture engages the meaning of the extremely obscure, then a consciousness that does not rely on scripture would also engage the meaning of the obscure.üîΩIf a consciousness that does not rely on scripture engages the meaning of the extremely obscure, then a consciousness that does not rely on scripture would also engage the meaning of the obscure.üîΩIf a consciousness that does not rely on scripture engages the meaning of the extremely obscure, then a consciousness that does not rely on scripture would also engage the meaning of the obscure.

original: shes pa la lung med na zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //üîΩgang gi tshe de lta yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: shes pa la lung med na zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro // gang gi tshe de lta yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: If a consciousness that does not rely on scripture engages the meaning of the extremely obscure, then a consciousness that does not rely on scripture would also engage the meaning of the obscure.

original: dbang po las 'das don rig 'ga' //üîΩde yod do zhes ni bdag nyid mngon 'gyur ro //üîΩgal te skyes bu rgyal dpog pa'am /
analyzed: dbang po las 'das don rig 'ga' //üîΩde yod do zhes ni bdag nyid mngon 'gyur ro //üîΩgal te skyes bu rgyal dpog pa'am /
translated: If a consciousness that does not rely on scripture engages the meaning of the extremely obscure, then a consciousness that does not rely on scripture would also engage the meaning of the obscure.

original: gzhan yang rig byed kyi don 'chad pa po lung la ltos pa med pa'i shes pa ji lta ba de lta bu nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rig byed kyi don 'chad pa po lung la ltos pa med pa'i shes pa ji lta ba de lta bu nyid yin te /
translated: Moreover, it would follow that the expounders of the meaning of the Vedas would be like the clairvoyant, who does not rely on scripture.

original: phyin ci ma log pa lkog tu gyur ba'i don mtho ris la sogs pa'i shes pa 'dod pa de'i tshe dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong ba rgyal dpog pa la sogs pa dang 'dra bar skyes bu gzhan yang yod do zhes 'dod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa lkog tu gyur ba'i don mtho ris la sogs pa'i shes pa 'dod pa de'i tshe dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong ba rgyal dpog pa la sogs pa dang 'dra bar skyes bu gzhan yang yod do zhes 'dod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you assert that the clairvoyant has a non mistaken consciousness that understands the hidden meaning of heaven and so on, then you would have to assert that there are other beings who see objects beyond the senses, like the clairvoyant Purana.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur na dbang po las 'das pa'i don mngon sum nyid kyis shes nas ston par byed pa de lta na de'i don rig pa rgyal dpog pa la sogs pa yin par ni mi 'dod kyi 'on kyang rjes su dpag pas yin pa de ltar na
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na dbang po las 'das pa'i don mngon sum nyid kyis shes nas ston par byed pa de lta na de'i don rig pa rgyal dpog pa la sogs pa yin par ni mi 'dod kyi 'on kyang rjes su dpag pas yin pa de ltar na
translated: If that were so, then the clairvoyant would directly perceive objects beyond the senses and then teach them. In that case, you would not assert that the clairvoyant knows the meaning of the Vedas, but rather that he infers it.

original: / gang gis nyes pa 'dir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: / gang gis nyes pa 'dir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then how could this fault arise?

original: de ni ma yin te gal te dbang po las 'das pa'i don de ni mngon sum gyis mthong bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe de sngon du song ba can gyi rjes su dpag pa de la 'jug par 'gyur ro //

translated: That is not so. If that object beyond the senses were seen by direct perception, then inference would engage it, having that as its antecedent.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mngon sum sngon du song ba can gyi rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i tshad ma dag ni de mthong ba med pas /
analyzed: mngon sum sngon du song ba can gyi rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i tshad ma dag ni de mthong ba med pas /
translated: Because valid cognitions such as inference that have direct perception as their antecedent do not see that object.

original: dbang po las 'das pa de mngon sum gyis mthong ba med pa la mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa de mngon sum gyis mthong ba med pa la mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible for direct perception to see that object beyond the senses.

original: mngon sum zhes bya ba la @49b sogs bas da nyid gsal bar byed de /üîΩdbang po las 'das pa'i don de dag la mngon sum 'jug pa med pa'i rgyu'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon sum zhes bya ba la @49b sogs bas da nyid gsal bar byed de / dbang po las 'das pa'i don de dag la mngon sum 'jug pa med pa'i rgyu'i phyir /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdirect perception and so on‚Äù clarifies that.üîΩBecause direct perception does not engage those objects beyond the senses,

original: mngon sum sngon du song ba can gyi tshad ma gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon sum sngon du song ba can gyi tshad ma gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir /
translated: it is impossible for other valid cognitions that have direct perception as their antecedent to engage them.

original: de la dmigs pa ma yin pa rtogs par bya ba zhes bya ba ni mngon sum la sogs pas dmigs pa ma yin pa rtogs pa'i rten du gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa ma yin pa rtogs par bya ba zhes bya ba ni mngon sum la sogs pas dmigs pa ma yin pa rtogs pa'i rten du gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not a basis for the understanding of what is not perceived‚Äù means that it is not a basis for the understanding of what is not perceived by perception, etc.

original: don gang mngon sum la sogs pa'i yul ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don gang mngon sum la sogs pa'i yul ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not the object of perception, etc.

original: de rtogs par bya ba la ste nges par bya ba'i don du lung tshol bar byed do zhes bya ba khong nas dbyung ngo //
analyzed: de rtogs par bya ba la ste nges par bya ba'i don du lung tshol bar byed do zhes bya ba khong nas dbyung ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúOne seeks testimony for the purpose of understanding that‚Äù means for the purpose of ascertaining that.

original: rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa tshad ma gzhan dbang po las 'das pa'i don de la 'jug pas ;
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa tshad ma gzhan dbang po las 'das pa'i don de la 'jug pas ;
translated: Inference, etc., are other means of valid knowledge that engage the object beyond the senses.

original: dbang po las 'das pa'i yul can gyi mngon sum grub par byed cing rjes su 'dren par byed kyi mngon sum gyis 'jug pa med par tshad ma gzhan 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa'i yul can gyi mngon sum grub par byed cing rjes su 'dren par byed kyi mngon sum gyis 'jug pa med par tshad ma gzhan 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They establish and lead to the perception that has an object beyond the senses, because without the engagement of perception, the engagement of other means of valid knowledge is impossible.

original: gal te gtan tshigs kyis skyes bu'i phul du byung ba dag ste /
analyzed: gal te gtan tshigs kyis skyes bu'i phul du byung ba dag ste /
translated: If the person is an excellent one, the means of valid knowledge are inference, etc.,

original: dbang po las 'das pa'i don dag mthong ba dpyod pa pa dag gis bzlog par mi 'gyur na bzlog pa yang yin no //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa'i don dag mthong ba dpyod pa pa dag gis bzlog par mi 'gyur na bzlog pa yang yin no //
translated: If the rationalists cannot refute the existence of objects that are beyond the senses, then the existence of such objects is established.

original: de bas na dbang po las 'das pa'i don dag la tshad ma gzhan 'jug pa ma yin no //üîΩtshad ma gzhan 'jug pa med pa'i gtan tshigs de nyid kyi phyir lung rig byed mtho ris la sogs pa dbang po las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi don la don 'di nyid la sgra 'di 'jug go zhes bya ba'i 'jug pa gang yin pa ste nges pa
analyzed: de bas na dbang po las 'das pa'i don dag la tshad ma gzhan 'jug pa ma yin no // tshad ma gzhan 'jug pa med pa'i gtan tshigs de nyid kyi phyir lung rig byed mtho ris la sogs pa dbang po las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi don la don 'di nyid la sgra 'di 'jug go zhes bya ba'i 'jug pa gang yin pa ste nges pa

original: gal te slob dpong phyogs kyi glang pos rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid mdzad pa de lta na yang rgyas par rnam par dkrugs nas rnam par gzhag pa de lta na skyon yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te slob dpong phyogs kyi glang pos rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid mdzad pa de lta na yang rgyas par rnam par dkrugs nas rnam par gzhag pa de lta na skyon yod pa ma yin no //

original: de la ci'i phyir rim pa las rgal nas @71b mdzad ces bya ba'i rtsod pa 'di la /
analyzed: de la ci'i phyir rim pa las rgal nas @71b mdzad ces bya ba'i rtsod pa 'di la /

analyzed: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid kyi bstan bcos te /

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bka' zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: de'i bshad pa'i rgyu ni tshad ma'i mtshan nyid kyi bstan bcos bshad pa'i rgyu'o //

analyzed: slob dpon gyi yang de yin la chad ma'i mtshan nyid kyi bstan bcos bshad pa'i rgyu yang de yin pas na zhes bya ba ni las 'dzin pa'o //

original: de gang zhe na rjes su dpag pa ste /
analyzed: de gang zhe na rjes su dpag pa ste /

analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ston pa'i phyir tshad ma kun las btus pa'i rang gi don rjes su dpag pa'i le'u ni rjes su dpag pa'o //

original: de skad du gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pa la brten nas /
analyzed: de skad du gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pa la brten nas /
translated: It is said that because it is based on inference,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' rigs pa dang ldan pa yin gyi /
translated: the word of the Blessed One is reasonable,

analyzed: gzhan mu stegs pa dag gi ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //

original: de skad du bshad pa ni rnam pa gzhan yin no //
analyzed: de skad du bshad pa ni rnam pa gzhan yin no //

original: rjes su dpag pa de yang rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i le'ur rnam par phye ba de bas na tshad ma kun las btus pa'i rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i le'u de nyid rtsod ngan lan btab pa'i sgo nas sngar rnam par bshad paüîΩnyid yin no //

original: tshad ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas zhes bya ba ni tshad ma slu med can zhes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: tshad ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas zhes bya ba ni tshad ma slu med can zhes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //

original: de la 'grel pa mdzad pa bdag nyid kyis tshigs su bcad pa'i 'grel pa mdzad cing /
analyzed: de la 'grel pa mdzad pa bdag nyid kyis tshigs su bcad pa'i 'grel pa mdzad cing /

analyzed: tshad mar gyur pa zhes bya ba de 'chad pa la /

analyzed: tshad ma yang de yin la gyur pa yang de yin pas na tshad mar gyur pa'o //

analyzed: de ltar na tshad ma rtag par rtog pa gsal ba yin no //

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa ni tshad ma yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa ni tshad ma yin pa de bas na /

original: ji ltar na bcom ldan 'das de'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa la de skad du ce na tshad ma dang 'dra bas na tshad ma ste zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar na bcom ldan 'das de'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa la de skad du ce na tshad ma dang 'dra bas na tshad ma ste zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: tshad ma'i sgra dpe nad du 'dus pa can yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // gal te bsgoms pa'i stobs las grub pa dri ma med pa rnam par mi rtog pa 'khrul pa med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir bcom ldan @72a * //
translated: The term valid cognition is a metaphor.üîΩIf the Bhagavat is the nature of direct valid cognition because he is the embodiment of stainless, nonconceptual, nonerroneous exalted wisdom that is accomplished through the power of meditation,

analyzed: 'das ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i rang bzhin can nyid du dngos su bzhugs pa nyid yin na nye bar btags pa la brten pas ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: why is he called a valid cognition by metaphor?

original: 'di la skyon yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di la skyon yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no fault here because

analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa'i gnas skabs la dgongs nas brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag gi yin no //

original: 'dir gal te bcom ldan 'das ni ji skad du bshad pa'i tshad ma'i bdag nyid can yin pa de lta na yang de ltar rab tu grags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gal te bcom ldan 'das ni ji skad du bshad pa'i tshad ma'i bdag nyid can yin pa de lta na yang de ltar rab tu grags pa ma yin no //
translated: Here, one might say, even if the Lord is the nature of valid cognition as explained, it is not well known in that way.

original: de bas na tha snyad du byas pa'i tshad mas dper mdzad pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na tha snyad du byas pa'i tshad mas dper mdzad pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni rigs pa yin no //

original: tshad ma slu med can shes pa //
analyzed: tshad ma slu med can shes pa //

analyzed: tshad ma nyid de yang gal te spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pa de lta bas na slu bar byed pas na slu ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas de 'chad par byed do //
translated: If that valid cognition is a general definition, then he explains it with the statement beginning because it is deceptive, and so on.

original: tshad ma slu med can zhes bya ba de tsam gyi shes pa zhes bya ba thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshad ma slu med can zhes bya ba de tsam gyi shes pa zhes bya ba thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: One does not attain the mere statement valid cognition is non-deceptive cognition and cognition.

original: yul la yang mi slu bar yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yul la yang mi slu bar yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the object also exists without being deceptive.

original: de'i phyir shes pa smos pa byas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa smos pa byas so //
translated: Therefore, the word ‚Äúknowledge‚Äù is used.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir mi slu ba de yang don yongs su bcad nas 'jug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir mi slu ba de yang don yongs su bcad nas 'jug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says, ‚ÄúThat non-deceptive [knowledge] engages after ascertaining the object.‚Äù

original: mi slu ba de yang yul gyi chos dang zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: mi slu ba de yang yul gyi chos dang zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
translated: That non-deceptive [knowledge] is also connected with the words ‚Äúthe object‚Äôs property.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe 'dir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'dir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: When does it occur?

original: don yongs su bcad nas 'jug pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: don yongs su bcad nas 'jug pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúafter ascertaining the object.‚Äù

original: ci rigs par tshad ma gnyis kyis yongs su bcad par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ci rigs par tshad ma gnyis kyis yongs su bcad par blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be seen that it is ascertained by the two valid cognitions, as is appropriate.

original: mngon sum ni rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid kyi phyir nges pa ma yin mod kyi 'on kyang der snang bar skyes pa tsam yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum ni rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid kyi phyir nges pa ma yin mod kyi 'on kyang der snang bar skyes pa tsam yin no //
translated: Although direct perception is not a determination because it is non-conceptual, nevertheless, it is merely the arising of the appearance of that [object].

original: rjes su dpag pa ni nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: Inference is a determination.

original: gal te mngon sum rtog pa med pas chu la sogs pa bden pa dang brdzun pa rnam par 'byed par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ji ltar de las don yongs su bkag nas 'jug ce na /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum rtog pa med pas chu la sogs pa bden pa dang brdzun pa rnam par 'byed par mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ji ltar de las don yongs su bkag nas 'jug ce na /
translated: If direct perception is unable to distinguish true and false water, etc., because it is non-conceptual, how does it engage after ascertaining the object?

original: brjod pa mngon sum gyi rten can gyi 'jug pa ni rnam pa gnyis te dang po nyid dang goms pa can no //
analyzed: brjod pa mngon sum gyi rten can gyi 'jug pa ni rnam pa gnyis te dang po nyid dang goms pa can no //
translated: The operation of the direct perception that is based on verbal testimony is of two kinds: (1) that which is based on the first operation of direct perception, and (2) that which is based on the operation of direct perception that is habitual.

original: de la goms pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de la shin tu goms pa gsal ba can gyi mngon sum skyes pa na ji lta ba bzhin du goms pa'i rnam par 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan spangs pa can nyid kyis yongs su bcad nas skye ba dang /
analyzed: de la goms pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de la shin tu goms pa gsal ba can gyi mngon sum skyes pa na ji lta ba bzhin du goms pa'i rnam par 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan spangs pa can nyid kyis yongs su bcad nas skye ba dang /
translated: In the case of the person who is habituated to the operation of direct perception, when the direct perception that is based on the operation of direct perception that is habitual arises, it arises having eliminated the cause of error that is based on the operation of direct perception that is habitual, and thus it is as if it were free of the cause of error.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i phyis 'byung ba'i nges pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir de la skyes bu 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i phyis 'byung ba'i nges pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir de la skyes bu 'jug par byed do //
translated: And because it generates the certainty that arises later in the form of the elimination of the cause of error, the person engages in the operation of direct perception that is based on the operation of direct perception that is habitual.

original: de'i phyir de la rang nyid kyi tshad ma nges par @72b byed pa'i phyir phyis kyi tshad ma 'jug pa la ltos pa med pa can yin pa'i phyir don yongs su bcad nas zhes bya ba'i tshig mi 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la rang nyid kyi tshad ma nges par @72b byed pa'i phyir phyis kyi tshad ma 'jug pa la ltos pa med pa can yin pa'i phyir don yongs su bcad nas zhes bya ba'i tshig mi 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because the certainty of the person‚Äôs own valid cognition is generated in that way, the later operation of valid cognition is not dependent on anything else. Thus the statement ‚Äúhaving eliminated the object‚Äù is not untenable.

original: mngon sum thams cad ni gzhan la tshad ma nges par gzhag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum thams cad ni gzhan la tshad ma nges par gzhag pa ma yin no //
translated: And all direct perception is not dependent on the certainty of another‚Äôs valid cognition.

original: dang po nyid kyis 'jug pa gang yin pa de la yang rgyu mtshan nges par gzung ba med pa na the tshom nyid kyi sgo nas 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: dang po nyid kyis 'jug pa gang yin pa de la yang rgyu mtshan nges par gzung ba med pa na the tshom nyid kyi sgo nas 'jug par byed do //
translated: When the reason is not ascertained, one engages through doubt.

original: gal te 'o na don yongs su bcad nas zhes bya ba'i tshig ji ltar rung zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'o na don yongs su bcad nas zhes bya ba'i tshig ji ltar rung zhe na /
translated: If that is so, how can it be correct to say that one engages having ascertained the meaning?

original: de'i rnam par skyes pa tsam de skad du tha snyad gdags so zhes bya ba bshad zin to //
analyzed: de'i rnam par skyes pa tsam de skad du tha snyad gdags so zhes bya ba bshad zin to //
translated: It is said that it is so designated merely because it arises in that aspect.

original: gal te the tshom gyi sgo nas 'jug pa yin na ji ltar rtog pa sngon du song ba can zhes bya zhe na 'di la 'gal ba ci yod /
analyzed: gal te the tshom gyi sgo nas 'jug pa yin na ji ltar rtog pa sngon du song ba can zhes bya zhe na 'di la 'gal ba ci yod /
translated: If one engages through doubt, how can it be said that it is preceded by investigation? What contradiction is there?

original: gang kho na nges pa'i sgo nas 'jug par 'gyur ba de nyid rtog pa sngon du song ba can ma yin no //
analyzed: gang kho na nges pa'i sgo nas 'jug par 'gyur ba de nyid rtog pa sngon du song ba can ma yin no //
translated: That which engages through ascertainment is not preceded by investigation.

original: de ltar na 'jug par byed pa la don la the tshom za ba dang don nges pa dang rgyu rnam pa gnyis yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'jug par byed pa la don la the tshom za ba dang don nges pa dang rgyu rnam pa gnyis yin no //
translated: Thus, there are two causes of engagement: doubt about the meaning and ascertainment of the meaning.

original: ldog pa yang don med pa la the tshom za ba dang / don med par nges pa gnyis kho na yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa yang don med pa la the tshom za ba dang / don med par nges pa gnyis kho na yin no //
translated: and the two kinds of turning away are also just two: doubt about the nonexistence of the object and certainty about the nonexistence of the object.

original: de la dang po nyid kyi rgyu gnyis kyis 'jug par 'gyur ba gang yin pa dang phyis bshad pa gnyis kyis ldog par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni rtog pa sngon du song ba can yin par 'jig rten dag brjod do //
analyzed: de la dang po nyid kyi rgyu gnyis kyis 'jug par 'gyur ba gang yin pa dang phyis bshad pa gnyis kyis ldog par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni rtog pa sngon du song ba can yin par 'jig rten dag brjod do //
translated: The world says that the two kinds of engagement are preceded by conception, and the two kinds of turning away are preceded by conception.

original: gal te nges pa nyid kyi sgo nas 'jug par byed par 'gyur ba ngo mtshar yin na /
analyzed: gal te nges pa nyid kyi sgo nas 'jug par byed par 'gyur ba ngo mtshar yin na /
translated: If it is surprising that one engages in something by means of certainty,

original: 'o na ni zhing pa la sogs pa zhing la sogs pa la 'jug par byed pa 'gal bar 'gyur te de dag la ma 'ongs pa'i 'bru la sogs pa 'grub pa la nges par byed pa'i tshad ma yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni zhing pa la sogs pa zhing la sogs pa la 'jug par byed pa 'gal bar 'gyur te de dag la ma 'ongs pa'i 'bru la sogs pa 'grub pa la nges par byed pa'i tshad ma yod pa ma yin no //
translated: then it is contradictory that farmers, etc., engage in farming, etc., because they do not have a valid cognition that ascertains the production of future crops, etc.

original: mi slu ba yul gyi chos de mtshan nyid ci 'dra ba can zhig ce na ji ltar 'dod pa'i don de lta bu'i ngo bo'i zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mi slu ba yul gyi chos de mtshan nyid ci 'dra ba can zhig ce na ji ltar 'dod pa'i don de lta bu'i ngo bo'i zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: What is the nature of the nondeceptive object?

original: ji ltar ngo bo gang gis don du gnyer ba'i me la sogs pa ni ji ltar 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar ngo bo gang gis don du gnyer ba'i me la sogs pa ni ji ltar 'dod pa ste /
translated: Just as fire, etc. are the entities that are sought, so too are they the objects that are sought.

original: dngos po las ma 'das pa zhes bya ba ni mi zad pa'i bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po las ma 'das pa zhes bya ba ni mi zad pa'i bsdu ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnot beyond the entities‚Äù is a summary of the inexhaustible.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa yang de yin la don yang yin pas na ji ltar 'dod pa'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa yang de yin la don yang yin pas na ji ltar 'dod pa'i don to //
translated: Since they are both objects that are sought and objects that are sought in a particular way, they are objects that are sought in a particular way.

original: de'i de lta bu'i ngo bo ni de'i ngo bo nyid de me la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i de lta bu'i ngo bo ni de'i ngo bo nyid de me la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The nature of those objects that are sought in a particular way is their nature. The meaning is: the nature of fire, etc.

original: de'i rnam par gzhag pa yang ji ltar yin zhe na don gyi rang gi nus pa grub pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i rnam par gzhag pa yang ji ltar yin zhe na don gyi rang gi nus pa grub pas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: How are they established in that way? He says, ‚Äúby the establishment of the intrinsic efficacy of the objects.‚Äù

original: me la sogs pa'i don gyi rang gi nus pa sreg pa dang 'tshod pa la sogs pa bsgrub par nus pa nyid do //
analyzed: me la sogs pa'i don gyi rang gi nus pa sreg pa dang 'tshod pa la sogs pa bsgrub par nus pa nyid do //
translated: The intrinsic efficacy of the objects, such as fire, is the capacity to accomplish the functions of burning, cooking, etc.

original: de'i grub pa ni nges pa ste des don de lta bu'i ngo bor rnam par 'jog ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i grub pa ni nges pa ste des don de lta bu'i ngo bor rnam par 'jog ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The establishment of that is ascertainment. The meaning is: by that, they are established as objects that have that kind of nature.

original: nus pa'i grub pa yang @73a * //
analyzed: nus pa'i grub pa yang @73a * //
translated: The establishment of efficacy is

original: 'bras bu rtsom pa can gyi 'bras bu mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu rtsom pa can gyi 'bras bu mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the effect of the activity of the cause is seen.

original: 'bras bu rtsom pa can ma yin pa'i yang de'i rigs can nyid yin pas na 'khrul pa med pa'i khyad par nges par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu rtsom pa can ma yin pa'i yang de'i rigs can nyid yin pas na 'khrul pa med pa'i khyad par nges par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and the effect is not a beginning, because it has the same nature. Therefore, the distinction of non-error is definitely grasped.

original: shes pa'i chos mi slu ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: shes pa'i chos mi slu ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The non-deceptive phenomenon of cognition is twofold:

original: de la 'dir mngon par 'dod pa ma yin pa gang yin pa dang mngon par 'dod pa gang yin pa de go rims bzhin du de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te de'i zhes bya ba'i don gyi'o //
analyzed: de la 'dir mngon par 'dod pa ma yin pa gang yin pa dang mngon par 'dod pa gang yin pa de go rims bzhin du de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te de'i zhes bya ba'i don gyi'o //
translated: Here, what is not intended and what is intended are stated in order, respectively, with that and so on. The meaning of that is as follows.

original: de lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo gang gis don byed par nus pa ste de'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo gang gis don byed par nus pa ste de'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having such a nature means having an essence that is able to perform a function. The meaning is that it has that essence.

original: ji ltar gnas pa'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa na zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar gnas pa'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa na zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: When the nature that exists is realized is the summarized meaning.

original: rjes su dpag pas don gyi rang gi ngo bo yongs su ma bcad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni spyi'i rnam pa la 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas don gyi rang gi ngo bo yongs su ma bcad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni spyi'i rnam pa la 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of the object is not ascertained by inference means because it engages only in a general form.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i don ni gang ched du byas nas 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i don ni gang ched du byas nas 'jug pa'o //
translated: The intended object is that for the sake of which one engages in the activity.

original: mi slu ba gang la de dang phrad par byed pa'i mtshan nyid de rang gi ngo bo yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: mi slu ba gang la de dang phrad par byed pa'i mtshan nyid de rang gi ngo bo yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The non-deceptive is that which has the characteristic of bringing about contact with that, and it exists in its own nature.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i khyab bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa la yang mngon par 'dod pa'i don dang phrad par byed pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i khyab bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa la yang mngon par 'dod pa'i don dang phrad par byed pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The pervasion by direct perception and inference is that which is to be inferred, because there is contact with the intended object.

original: don ni sreg pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: don ni sreg pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The object is burning, etc.

original: de'i byed pa ni skyed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i byed pa ni skyed pa'o //
translated: Its activity is production.

original: de'i gnas pa ni rtogs pa ste khams kyi don sna tshogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gnas pa ni rtogs pa ste khams kyi don sna tshogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Its state is realization, because of the various meanings of the elements.

original: de ni tshad mas yongs su nges pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed pa la /
analyzed: de ni tshad mas yongs su nges pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed pa la /
translated: That is ascertained by valid cognition, etc.

original: tshad ma dang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis yongs su nges pa'i don me la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma dang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis yongs su nges pa'i don me la sogs pa'o //
translated: The object ascertained by valid cognition, direct perception, and inference is fire, etc.

original: des bsgrub par bya ba'i don byed pa ni sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: des bsgrub par bya ba'i don byed pa ni sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The function of the object to be accomplished is burning, cooking, etc.üîΩThe capacity of fire to burn and cook, etc. is the universal of fire.üîΩThe capacity of fire to burn and cook, etc. is the universal of fire.üîΩThe universal of fire is the universal of all fires.üîΩThe capacity of fire to burn and cook, etc. is the universal of fire.

original: me sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i nus pa zhes bya ba ni me thams cad sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i nus pa med pa de ltar na khyad par gzung ba yin te /üîΩde lta bur gyur pa nyid la ni 'jug pa yan lag nyid yin no //
analyzed: me sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i nus pa zhes bya ba ni me thams cad sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i nus pa med pa de ltar na khyad par gzung ba yin te / de lta bur gyur pa nyid la ni 'jug pa yan lag nyid yin no //
translated: The capacity of fire to burn and cook, etc. is the universal of fire.üîΩThe capacity of fire to burn and cook, etc. is the universal of fire.

original: dro ba'i reg pa la sogs pa'i yul can gyi zhes bya ba ni dro ba'i reg pa'i yul can lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid can gyi 'jug pa'o ;
analyzed: dro ba'i reg pa la sogs pa'i yul can gyi zhes bya ba ni dro ba'i reg pa'i yul can lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid can gyi 'jug pa'o ;
