translated: The capacity of fire to burn and cook, etc. is the universal of fire.üîΩThe capacity of fire to burn and cook, etc. is the universal of fire.üîΩThe capacity of fire to burn and cook, etc. is the universal of fire.üîΩThe capacity of fire to burn and cook, etc. is the universal of fire.üîΩThe capacity of fire to burn and cook, etc. is the universal of fire.üîΩThe capacity of fire to burn and cook, etc. is the universal of fire.üîΩThe capacity of fire to burn and cook, etc. is the universal of fire.üîΩThe capacity of fire to burn and cook, etc. is the universal of fire.üîΩThe capacity of fire to burn and cook, etc. is the universal of fire.üîΩThe capacity of fire to burn and cook, etc. is the universal of fire.üîΩThe capacity of fire to burn and cook, etc. is the universal of fire.üîΩThe capacity of fire to burn and cook, etc. is the universal of fire.üîΩThe capacity of fire to burn and cook, etc. is the universal of fire.üîΩThe capacity of fire to burn and cook, etc. is the universal of fire.üîΩThe capacity of fire to burn and cook, etc. is the universal of fire.üîΩThe capacity of fire to burn and cook, etc. is the universal of fire.üîΩThe capacity of fire to burn and cook, etc. is the universal of fire.

original: mi slu bar nges pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir mi slu ba yin no //
analyzed: mi slu bar nges pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir mi slu ba yin no //
translated: The capacity of fire to burn and cook, etc. is the universal of fire.üîΩThe capacity of fire to burn and cook, etc. is the universal of fire

original: de ltar na mi slu ba ni 'dir phrad par nus pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na mi slu ba ni 'dir phrad par nus pa'o //
translated: Thus, nondeceptiveness here is the ability to contact.

original: de yang 'og @73b nas 'jog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang 'og @73b nas 'jog par 'gyur ro //
translated: And that will be established later.

original: de lta ma yin na gal te phyis kyi tshad ma'i 'jug pa nyid sngar gyi mi slu ba yin par 'gyur na de yang tshad ma nyid yin pa de ltar na tshad ma las tha dad pa'i tshad ma thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gal te phyis kyi tshad ma'i 'jug pa nyid sngar gyi mi slu ba yin par 'gyur na de yang tshad ma nyid yin pa de ltar na tshad ma las tha dad pa'i tshad ma thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, if the operation of a subsequent valid cognition were the nondeceptiveness of the former, and if that were a valid cognition, then a valid cognition would be obtained that is different from a valid cognition.

original: mngon sum gyi 'jug pa thams cad la phyis kyi tshad ma 'jug pa ma yin te la lar gags  byed pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi 'jug pa thams cad la phyis kyi tshad ma 'jug pa ma yin te la lar gags  byed pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Not all operations of perception are operations of a subsequent valid cognition, because it is possible that sometimes an obstruction occurs.

original: de bas na tshad ma'i mtshan nyid 'di yang khyab par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na tshad ma'i mtshan nyid 'di yang khyab par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, this definition of valid cognition is not a pervader.

original: 'ga' zhig gi tshe rjes su dpag pa'i zhes bya ba gdon mi za bar phyis kyi mngon sum gyi 'jug pa nyid snga ma'i mi slu ba ma yin mod kyi 'on kyang 'ga' zhig gi tshe rjes su dpag pa phyis 'byung ba can gyi 'jug pa yang dang
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi tshe rjes su dpag pa'i zhes bya ba gdon mi za bar phyis kyi mngon sum gyi 'jug pa nyid snga ma'i mi slu ba ma yin mod kyi 'on kyang 'ga' zhig gi tshe rjes su dpag pa phyis 'byung ba can gyi 'jug pa yang dang
translated: Sometimes, the operation of an inference is not the nondeceptiveness of the former, because it is not necessarily the operation of a subsequent valid cognition. However, sometimes the operation of an inference that occurs later is nondeceptive.

original: po'i mngon sum gyi mi slu ba yin no //
analyzed: po'i mngon sum gyi mi slu ba yin no //
translated: It is a nondeceptive perception of that.

original: gal te gang gi gnas skabs nyid las shes /
analyzed: gal te gang gi gnas skabs nyid las shes /
translated: If it is known from the state itself,üîΩhow is it that it is like fire?

original: ji ltar me nyid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: ji ltar me nyid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: rnam pa mtshungs pa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig gis zhes bya ba ni rnam pa mtshungs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa mtshungs pa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig gis zhes bya ba ni rnam pa mtshungs pa ste /
translated: By some similarity of aspect and so on.

original: de bas gzhan pa kha dog mtshungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bas gzhan pa kha dog mtshungs pa nyid do //
translated: Similarity of aspect is the same color.üîΩBy some similarity of thing, such as shape, size, and so on.üîΩBy some similarity of action, such as the action of burning, cooking, and so on.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni de dang 'dra ba'i dngos po dran pas der sgro 'dogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni de dang 'dra ba'i dngos po dran pas der sgro 'dogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: By some similarity of recollection of a thing like that, such as the recollection of a flower, a gem, and so on.

original: de ltar na ci 'di rgya skyegs kyi me tog gi tshogs sam /
analyzed: de ltar na ci 'di rgya skyegs kyi me tog gi tshogs sam /
translated: In that case, is this a collection of lac flowers or a heap of gems?

original: nor bu'i phung po yin zhes gang gi tshe mthong ba gsal ba med pa'i phyir 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nor bu'i phung po yin zhes gang gi tshe mthong ba gsal ba med pa'i phyir 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
translated: When there is no clear seeing, there is error because of the absence of clarity.

original: 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gsal bar mi nus pa dang phyis kyi tshad ma'i 'jug pa la ltos pa med par de'i 'bras bur gyur pa'i du ba mthong ba de nges par byas nas gang gi tshe me nges par byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gsal bar mi nus pa dang phyis kyi tshad ma'i 'jug pa la ltos pa med par de'i 'bras bur gyur pa'i du ba mthong ba de nges par byas nas gang gi tshe me nges par byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: and it is not possible to clarify the reason for error, and without depending on the later engagement of valid cognition, one ascertains the seeing of smoke, which is the effect of that [fire].

original: rjes su dpag pa'i 'jug pa ni dang po'i mngon sum gyi mi slu ba yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i 'jug pa ni dang po'i mngon sum gyi mi slu ba yin no //
translated: When one ascertains fire, the engagement of inference is the non-deception of the initial direct perception.

original: de'i tshe mngon sum ni 'jug par byed pa nyid ma yin gyi 'on kyang rjes su dpag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe mngon sum ni 'jug par byed pa nyid ma yin gyi 'on kyang rjes su dpag pa nyid yin no //
translated: At that time, direct perception is not the very engagement, but rather it is inference.

original: mi slu ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid tsam ni mngon sum de la yang yod pa de ltar na 'ba' zhig tu brjod do //
analyzed: mi slu ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid tsam ni mngon sum de la yang yod pa de ltar na 'ba' zhig tu brjod do //
translated: The mere characteristic of non-deception exists in that direct perception as well, and thus it is called mere.

original: du ba mngon sum gyis gzung ba na de la yang 'khrul pa'i rgyu yod pa'i phyir rtags nges pa nyid med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: du ba mngon sum gyis gzung ba na de la yang 'khrul pa'i rgyu yod pa'i phyir rtags nges pa nyid med pa ma yin nam /
translated: When smoke is apprehended by direct perception, since there is also a cause for error in that [smoke], isn't the ascertainment of the reason non-existent?üîΩIn that case, is this the entity of smoke emanated by a yogi,

original: de ltar na ci 'di ni rnal 'byor pas sprul pa'i du ba'i rnam pa'i dngos po'am /
analyzed: de ltar na ci 'di ni rnal 'byor pas sprul pa'i du ba'i rnam pa'i dngos po'am /
translated: or is it the entity of smoke that is the effect of fire?

original: ci brgya byin gyi spyi bo las byung ba yin zhes 'khrul pa'i rgyu yod do zhe na /
analyzed: ci brgya byin gyi spyi bo las byung ba yin zhes 'khrul pa'i rgyu yod do zhe na /
translated: But there is a cause of error, namely, the fact that the cognition arises from the top of Indra‚Äôs head.

original: 'dir smras pa ji ltar shin tu goms pa bsal ba thob pa can gyi mngon sum 'khrul pa'i rgyu spangs pa can skye par 'gyur ro //üîΩde ltar na nor bu dang gzugs su byas pa la sogs pa kha dog dang dbyibs @74a * //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa ji ltar shin tu goms pa bsal ba thob pa can gyi mngon sum 'khrul pa'i rgyu spangs pa can skye par 'gyur ro // de ltar na nor bu dang gzugs su byas pa la sogs pa kha dog dang dbyibs @74a * //
translated: We reply: The direct perception of one who has attained the elimination of the extremely familiar arises without a cause of error.

original: mtshungs pa goms pa las de shes pas mthong ba tsam gyis rnam par 'byed par byed do //
analyzed: mtshungs pa goms pa las de shes pas mthong ba tsam gyis rnam par 'byed par byed do //
translated: Thus, through familiarity with the similarity of color and shape of a jewel and a piece of coal, one can distinguish them merely by seeing them.

original: me las skyes pa'i du ba'i khyad par gang yin pa de ni rnal 'byor pas skyed par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: me las skyes pa'i du ba'i khyad par gang yin pa de ni rnal 'byor pas skyed par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: But the yogi cannot produce the particular smoke that arises from fire.

original: de ltar na rnal 'byor pas sprul pa na de dag nyid dam de dang 'dra ba sprul par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: de ltar na rnal 'byor pas sprul pa na de dag nyid dam de dang 'dra ba sprul par 'gyur grang na /
translated: Thus, when the yogi emanates, does he emanate just those or something similar to them?

original: re zhig de nyid ni ma yin te rgyu med pa can nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: re zhig de nyid ni ma yin te rgyu med pa can nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: First, it is not just those, because that would entail their being without a cause.

original: de dang 'dra ba yang ma yin te me'i rang bzhin ma yin pa las skye ba la de 'dra ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba yang ma yin te me'i rang bzhin ma yin pa las skye ba la de 'dra ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not similar to that, because that which is not the nature of fire does not arise from that.

original: de 'dra ba'i dngos po las 'byung ba ni de 'dra bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i dngos po las 'byung ba ni de 'dra bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: That which arises from a similar thing becomes similar.

original: de 'dra ba ma yin pa las de 'dra bar 'byung na ni de dang de ma yin pa'i ngo bo can nyid yin te /
analyzed: de 'dra ba ma yin pa las de 'dra bar 'byung na ni de dang de ma yin pa'i ngo bo can nyid yin te /
translated: If that which is not similar arises from that which is similar, then it would have a nature that is both that and not that.

original: dngos po rnams rgyu med pa can nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po rnams rgyu med pa can nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Things would arise without a cause.

original: de bas na me las skye ba'i du ba'i rnam pa'i khyad par rnal 'byor pas sprul par mi nus pa'am sprul pa yin na ni de nyid me yan par 'gyur ba de ltar na 'khrul pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na me las skye ba'i du ba'i rnam pa'i khyad par rnal 'byor pas sprul par mi nus pa'am sprul pa yin na ni de nyid me yan par 'gyur ba de ltar na 'khrul pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the yogi cannot emanate a particular aspect of smoke that arises from fire. If he could emanate it, then that would be fire. In that case, there would be no error.

original: de skad du yang mkhas pa'i skye bo ma lus pa'i gtsug gi nor bu dbang phyug dam pas /üîΩgal te brgya byin spyi bo me'i //üîΩrang bzhin yin na de nyid me //
analyzed: de skad du yang mkhas pa'i skye bo ma lus pa'i gtsug gi nor bu dbang phyug dam pas / gal te brgya byin spyi bo me'i // rang bzhin yin na de nyid me //
translated: The supreme lord, the crest jewel of all wise beings, said this:üîΩIf the head of Indra were the nature of fire,üîΩit would be fire itself.

original: 'on te de me'i rang bzhin min //
analyzed: 'on te de me'i rang bzhin min //
translated: If it were not the nature of fire,

original: ji ltar de las du ba 'byung //
analyzed: ji ltar de las du ba 'byung //
translated: How could smoke arise from it?

original: du ba rgyu yi rang bzhin me //
analyzed: du ba rgyu yi rang bzhin me //
translated: Smoke is not the nature of its cause,

original: de yi nus pa'i bye brag ldan //üîΩdu ba du ba'i rgyu min las //
analyzed: de yi nus pa'i bye brag ldan // du ba du ba'i rgyu min las //
translated: but it possesses a particular potency.üîΩIf smoke arose from a non-smoke cause,

original: byung na de ni rgyu med 'gyur //
analyzed: byung na de ni rgyu med 'gyur //
translated: it would be causeless.

original: zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained.

original: khyad par yang goms pa las nges pa yin te ji skad du /
analyzed: khyad par yang goms pa las nges pa yin te ji skad du /
translated: And the particular is ascertained from habituation, as it is said:

original: nor bu gzugs byas la sogs la //
analyzed: nor bu gzugs byas la sogs la //
translated: In the case of a jewel, a form, and so on,

original: de rig shes pa rjes dpag las //
analyzed: de rig shes pa rjes dpag las //
translated: the cognition of that is not inference,

original: byung min gzhan rnams la brjod med //
analyzed: byung min gzhan rnams la brjod med //
translated: but is said to arise from other things

original: goms pa nyid las skye bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes bshad pa yin no //üîΩji ltar mngon sum phyis kyi tshad ma 'jug par byed pa nyid kyi tshad ma yin pa de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa yang yin pa de bas na thug pa med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa dag la nges pa yod pa ma yin no zhe na
analyzed: goms pa nyid las skye bar 'gyur // zhes bshad pa yin no // ji ltar mngon sum phyis kyi tshad ma 'jug par byed pa nyid kyi tshad ma yin pa de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa yang yin pa de bas na thug pa med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa dag la nges pa yod pa ma yin no zhe na
translated: through habituation alone.üîΩJust as direct perception is valid cognition because it engages its object later, inference is also like that. Therefore, because there is no infinite regress, there is certainty in inferences.

original: / de'i phyir mngon sum nyid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te dang po'i mngon sum gyi don ni de'i don to //
analyzed: / de'i phyir mngon sum nyid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te dang po'i mngon sum gyi don ni de'i don to //
translated: To respond: Therefore, with regard to direct perception itself... The meaning of direct perception in the beginning is its meaning.

original: de'i don byed pa'i yul tshad ma gang la yod pa de ni de'i don gyi don byed pa'i yul can gyi tshad ma'o //
analyzed: de'i don byed pa'i yul tshad ma gang la yod pa de ni de'i don gyi don byed pa'i yul can gyi tshad ma'o //
translated: That which has the valid cognition that performs the function of that object is the valid cognition that has the object that performs the function of that object.

original: phyis kyi yang de nyid yin la de ni don gyi don byed pa'i yul can yin pas na zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: phyis kyi yang de nyid yin la de ni don gyi don byed pa'i yul can yin pas na zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi bsdu ba'o //
translated: The later one is just that, and that is the subject that performs the function of the object, so it is said. This is the inclusion of the distinction.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas rjes su dpag pa phyis kyi tshad ma'i 'jug pa la ltos pa sel bar byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas rjes su dpag pa phyis kyi tshad ma'i 'jug pa la ltos pa sel bar byed do //
translated: Thus, etc. eliminates the reliance on the later engagement of valid cognition in inference.

original: @74b rjes su dpag par bya ba mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa de'i rang bzhin rtags gang la yod pa de ni de'i rang bzhin can te byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i rtags sam 'bras bu du ba la sogs pa rtags can gyi shes pa'i rgyu yin
analyzed: @74b rjes su dpag par bya ba mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa de'i rang bzhin rtags gang la yod pa de ni de'i rang bzhin can te byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i rtags sam 'bras bu du ba la sogs pa rtags can gyi shes pa'i rgyu yin
translated: That which has the reason that has the nature of the object to be inferred, such as impermanence, is the one that has that nature, such as the reason of being produced or the effect such as smoke, which is the cause of the cognition that has the reason.

original: no zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: no zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is to be applied.

original: de lta bur gyur pa ni dngos po med pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin du gyur pa dang / 'bras bur gyur pa'i dngos po dang bral bar zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa ni dngos po med pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin du gyur pa dang / 'bras bur gyur pa'i dngos po dang bral bar zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That which is so is called ‚Äúnon-existent,‚Äù which means that it is devoid of the nature of an entity and the nature of an effect.

original: de bas na rjes su dpag pa ni rang nyid kyis tshad ma nyid du rnam par gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir thug pa med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rjes su dpag pa ni rang nyid kyis tshad ma nyid du rnam par gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir thug pa med pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, inference is not without a basis, because it is established as a valid cognition by itself.

original: gzhan dag tu ni zhes bya ba ni mngon sum la'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag tu ni zhes bya ba ni mngon sum la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn other cases‚Äù refers to perception.

original: goms pa med par mthong ba gsal ba po med pa'i phyir khyad par nges pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: goms pa med par mthong ba gsal ba po med pa'i phyir khyad par nges pa med pa yin te /
translated: Without practice, there is no clear seeing, and therefore no ascertainment of distinctions.

original: 'dis ni dang po nyid kyi 'jug par byed pa'i gnas skabs bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni dang po nyid kyi 'jug par byed pa'i gnas skabs bshad do //
translated: This explains the initial stage of engagement.

original: de'i tshe the tshom gyis kyang 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: de'i tshe the tshom gyis kyang 'jug par byed do //
translated: At that time, even doubt causes engagement.

original: goms pa las kyang khyad par nges par gzung ba yod na phyis kyi tshad ma'i 'jug pa la mngon sum yang ltos pa ma yin no zhes don gyis bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: goms pa las kyang khyad par nges par gzung ba yod na phyis kyi tshad ma'i 'jug pa la mngon sum yang ltos pa ma yin no zhes don gyis bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: And from practice, if there is ascertainment of distinctions, later engagement of valid cognition does not depend on perception. This is the implied explanation.

original: gal te phyis kyi tshad ma'i 'jug pas dang po'i mi slu ba yin par rig par bya ba yin na de rtogs pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gal te phyis kyi tshad ma'i 'jug pas dang po'i mi slu ba yin par rig par bya ba yin na de rtogs pas ci zhig bya /
translated: If the validity of the latter cognition is known to be nondeceptive with regard to the former, then what is the use of understanding that?

original: de ni de'i tshe 'jug par byed pa nyid ma yin te 'das pa nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩbden te 'jug par byed pa nyid kyi de'i tshe /
analyzed: de ni de'i tshe 'jug par byed pa nyid ma yin te 'das pa nyid kyi phyir ro // bden te 'jug par byed pa nyid kyi de'i tshe /
translated: At that time, the former cognition is not itself engaged, because it has already passed away.üîΩGranted, but at that time, it is not that the former cognition is being ascertained as valid cognition.

original: de'i tshad ma nyid kyi nges pa la rtsol ba ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang tshad mas nges pa de la de'i rigs can nyid kyis mngon sum gyi gsal ba'i bye brag gzhan mi slu ba can nyid du nges pa'i don du yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshad ma nyid kyi nges pa la rtsol ba ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang tshad mas nges pa de la de'i rigs can nyid kyis mngon sum gyi gsal ba'i bye brag gzhan mi slu ba can nyid du nges pa'i don du yin no //
translated: Rather, the point is that the certainty of the validity of that former cognition is ascertained to be nondeceptive with regard to the particular instance of the object that is of the same type as the former cognition.üîΩIf the latter direct perception is also like this, then there is an infinite regress.

original: gal te phyis kyi mngon sum yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas thug pa med par dogs pa yin te ji ltar na mngon sum snga ma dang khyad par med pa yin zhe na /üîΩsmras pa dngos po la 'jug pa ma yin par the tshom za ba ste /
analyzed: gal te phyis kyi mngon sum yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas thug pa med par dogs pa yin te ji ltar na mngon sum snga ma dang khyad par med pa yin zhe na /üîΩsmras pa dngos po la 'jug pa ma yin par the tshom za ba ste /
translated: How can the latter direct perception be ascertained to be nondeceptive with regard to the former direct perception, since they are not of the same type?üîΩThe former direct perception is not ascertained to be nondeceptive with regard to the latter direct perception, because the latter direct perception is not ascertained to be nondeceptive with regard to the former direct perception.

original: ji ltar me'i shes pa dang po me med par yang 'jug par the tshom za ba de ltar sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i shes pa yang ci rmi lam dang 'dra bar me med par sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i shes pa skye ba'am
analyzed: ji ltar me'i shes pa dang po me med par yang 'jug par the tshom za ba de ltar sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i shes pa yang ci rmi lam dang 'dra bar me med par sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i shes pa skye ba'am
translated: Just as there is doubt whether the first cognition of fire engages fire, so too there is doubt whether the cognition of burning and boiling is like a dream, a cognition of burning and boiling without fire,

original: ci yod pa la zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: ci yod pa la zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: or whether it is like waking cognition, a cognition of burning and boiling with fire.

original: ci ste de la yang mi slu ba gzhan ltos par 'gyur la de la yang gzhan zhes bya ba ni thug pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: ci ste de la yang mi slu ba gzhan ltos par 'gyur la de la yang gzhan zhes bya ba ni thug pa med pa yin no //
translated: But if you say that it is not deceptive with respect to that, then it would depend on another, and if it depends on another, then there would be an infinite regress.

original: ci ste shes pa 'ga' zhig mi slu bar rang nyid kyis 'dod na dang po'i yang de kho na bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste shes pa 'ga' zhig mi slu bar rang nyid kyis 'dod na dang po'i yang de kho na bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: But if you assert that some cognition is nondeceptive by itself, then the first would be just like that.

original: de skad du yang gzhon nu ma len gyis //üîΩji ltar dang po'i shes pa nyid //
analyzed: de skad du yang gzhon nu ma len gyis // ji ltar dang po'i shes pa nyid //
translated: Kumarila says:üîΩIf the first cognitionüîΩdepended on another,

original: de mi slu la ltos 'gyur na //
analyzed: de mi slu la ltos 'gyur na //
translated: because it is nondeceptive,

original: de ltar mi @75a * //üîΩslu nyid kyis kyang //
analyzed: de ltar mi @75a * // slu nyid kyis kyang //
translated: then that nondeceptiveness

original: mi slu ba yang btsal bar bya //üîΩgal te la lar rang nyid las //
analyzed: mi slu ba yang btsal bar bya // gal te la lar rang nyid las //
translated: would also have to be sought.üîΩIf you assert that it is valid cognition

original: tshad ma nyid du 'dod na ni //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid du 'dod na ni //
translated: with respect to some object by itself,

original: dang po'i de lta'i dngos yin na //
analyzed: dang po'i de lta'i dngos yin na //
translated: If it is the entity of the first,

original: rgyu gang gis na rab tu sdang // zhes smras so //
analyzed: rgyu gang gis na rab tu sdang // zhes smras so //
translated: by what cause is it thoroughly rejected?

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa lan 'debs par byed pa la /
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa lan 'debs par byed pa la /
translated: The reply is, ‚ÄúNo, etc.‚Äù

original: gnyi ga zhes bya ba ni mer snang ba dang sreg pa la sogs pa snang ba dag go //
analyzed: gnyi ga zhes bya ba ni mer snang ba dang sreg pa la sogs pa snang ba dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúBoth‚Äù refers to the appearance as fire and the appearance of burning, etc.

original: mer snang ba ni dngos po med pa la yang 'jug mod kyi sreg pa la sogs par snang bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mer snang ba ni dngos po med pa la yang 'jug mod kyi sreg pa la sogs par snang bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The appearance as fire does indeed occur even in the absence of an entity, but the appearance of burning, etc., does not occur.

original: de nyid ni me med pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid ni me med pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: This is the point of the statement, ‚ÄúIn the absence of fire, etc.‚Äù

original: de ni dngos po'i rten can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i don byed pa'i yul can gyi shes pa skye ba ni'o //
analyzed: de ni dngos po'i rten can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i don byed pa'i yul can gyi shes pa skye ba ni'o //
translated: The reply is, ‚ÄúBecause it has a basis in an entity,‚Äù i.e., the arising of the cognition that has as its object the function of burning, cooking, etc.,

original: skye ba na yang mi slu ba kho na yin te gal te de lta bur gyur pa'i 'jug par byed pa las kyang 'jug pa'i ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i don skye bar 'gyur ba na snga ma de'i mi slu ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: skye ba na yang mi slu ba kho na yin te gal te de lta bur gyur pa'i 'jug par byed pa las kyang 'jug pa'i ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i don skye bar 'gyur ba na snga ma de'i mi slu ba nyid yin te /
translated: And when it arises, it is nondeceptive. If the object that is to be engaged arises in accordance with the desire of the one who engages it, then the former is nondeceptive.

original: de nyid tshad ma yin gyi 'khrul pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid tshad ma yin gyi 'khrul pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this is that it is a valid cognition and not a delusion.

original: dngos po ni de tsam gyi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i don gyi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir me gang yin pa de nyid sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa byed pa dang chu gang yin
analyzed: dngos po ni de tsam gyi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i don gyi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir me gang yin pa de nyid sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa byed pa dang chu gang yin
translated: Because a thing is merely a cause. Because it is the cause of the object to be burned, cooked, and so on, that which is fire is that which burns, cooks, and so on. That which is water

original: pa de nyid khrus dang btung ba la sogs pa byed de /
analyzed: pa de nyid khrus dang btung ba la sogs pa byed de /
translated: is that which cleans and is drunk, and so on.

original: dngos po ni don byed par nus pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po ni don byed par nus pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a thing is characterized by the ability to perform a function.

original: gal te rmi lam la yang ji skad du bshad pa'i don la mi slu ba yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rmi lam la yang ji skad du bshad pa'i don la mi slu ba yod do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that even in a dream there is nondeception with respect to the object as it has been explained,

original: de la yang dngos po yod pa ni bla ste gnyid ma log pa'i gnas skabs na yang dngos po rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: de la yang dngos po yod pa ni bla ste gnyid ma log pa'i gnas skabs na yang dngos po rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu gzhan ni med do //
translated: Moreover, the existence of things is obvious, for even when one is not asleep, there is no other cause for the positing of things.

original: gal te rmi lam gyi shes pa tshad mar 'gyur ro zhe na 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: gal te rmi lam gyi shes pa tshad mar 'gyur ro zhe na 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir skyon med do //
translated: If you say that the consciousness in a dream is a valid cognition, there is no error, because we accept that.

original: gal te 'o na ji ltar na tshad ma ma yin par bshad ce na /
analyzed: gal te 'o na ji ltar na tshad ma ma yin par bshad ce na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúHow can it be explained that it is not a valid cognition?‚Äù

original: 'khrul ba yin no snyam pa'i bsam pas so //
analyzed: 'khrul ba yin no snyam pa'i bsam pas so //
translated: It is because of the thought that it is mistaken.

original: de'i phyir don byed par nus pa'i yul can gyi mngon sum ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid kyi bdag nyid du gyur pas rang rig pas yongs su bcad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir don byed par nus pa'i yul can gyi mngon sum ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid kyi bdag nyid du gyur pas rang rig pas yongs su bcad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, direct perception, which has an object that is able to perform a function, is itself a valid cognition because there is no reason for it to be mistaken. It is ascertained by reflexive awareness.

original: ji ltar yongs su bcad pa bzhin du de la nges par skyed par byed pa de ltar na rang nyid kyis tshad ma yin pa de'i phyir thug pa med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su bcad pa bzhin du de la nges par skyed par byed pa de ltar na rang nyid kyis tshad ma yin pa de'i phyir thug pa med pa ma yin no //
translated: Just as it is ascertained, it produces a definite cognition of that object. In that case, it is itself a valid cognition. Therefore, there is no infinite regress.

original: dang po'i me dang chur snang ba'i shes pa yang goms pa med pa na rang rgyud kyi tshad ma nyid kyis gzung du zin kyang 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan yod pa'i phyir nges pa bskyed pa'i nus @75b pa med pa de bas na /
analyzed: dang po'i me dang chur snang ba'i shes pa yang goms pa med pa na rang rgyud kyi tshad ma nyid kyis gzung du zin kyang 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan yod pa'i phyir nges pa bskyed pa'i nus @75b pa med pa de bas na /
translated: Also, the consciousness that appears as fire and water in the beginning, even though it is apprehended by valid cognition in one‚Äôs own continuum, is not capable of generating certainty because there is a reason for error.

original: de la phyis kyi tshad ma 'jug pas tshad ma nyid du rnam par gzhag pa /
analyzed: de la phyis kyi tshad ma 'jug pas tshad ma nyid du rnam par gzhag pa /
translated: Therefore, it is posited as valid cognition because later valid cognition engages it.

original: de ltar na gzhan las tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gzhan las tshad ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is valid cognition in relation to another.

original: de yang goms pa yod cing gsol ba can thob pa na rang nyid las yin te /
analyzed: de yang goms pa yod cing gsol ba can thob pa na rang nyid las yin te /
translated: Moreover, when there is familiarity and one obtains a supplication, it is from oneself.

original: sngar ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sngar ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is as previously explained.

original: de bas na 'di ltar mngon sum ni rang dang gzhan la tshad ma yin la rjes su dpag pa ni rang nyid las yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ltar mngon sum ni rang dang gzhan la tshad ma yin la rjes su dpag pa ni rang nyid las yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Therefore, it is established that direct perception is valid cognition in relation to oneself and another, and inference is from oneself.

original: gal te sngar gzung ba'i don phyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni skad cig ma nyid la brten nas rgol ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te sngar gzung ba'i don phyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni skad cig ma nyid la brten nas rgol ba yin no //
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúThe object apprehended earlier is not the same as the object apprehended later,‚Äù this is an objection based on momentariness.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
translated: The response to this is stated by ‚ÄúNo, because . . . ‚Äù

original: 'di skad du rnam pa gcig rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir 'jig rten dag don snga phyi gcig tu nges par byed cing de'i rjes su 'brangs nas de ltar rnam par 'jog pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du rnam pa gcig rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir 'jig rten dag don snga phyi gcig tu nges par byed cing de'i rjes su 'brangs nas de ltar rnam par 'jog pa yin te /
translated: In other words, it is because it is the cause of the understanding of a single aspect that worldly people determine the temporal priority and posteriority of objects to be one, and following that, they posit them in that way.

original: tshad ma'i rnam par 'jog pa ni tha snyad can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshad ma'i rnam par 'jog pa ni tha snyad can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is because the positing of valid cognition is conventional.

original: tshad ma snga phyi dag gi don dam par yul tha dad pa yin yang bla ste ji skad bshad pa'i skyon med pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: tshad ma snga phyi dag gi don dam par yul tha dad pa yin yang bla ste ji skad bshad pa'i skyon med pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It may be said, ‚ÄúIt is fine if the objects of the earlier and later valid cognitions are ultimately different objects, but the previously explained fault does not arise.‚Äù

original: de ltar na phyis kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la tshad ma snga ma'i yul med na med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni tshad ma snga ma'i yul ni tshad ma phyi ma'i yul la rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na phyis kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la tshad ma snga ma'i yul med na med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni tshad ma snga ma'i yul ni tshad ma phyi ma'i yul la rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In response to that, ‚ÄúIn that case . . . ‚Äù and so on is stated. Because the object of the earlier valid cognition does not exist without it, the object of the earlier valid cognition is the cause of the object of the later valid cognition.

original: rgyu med par 'bras bu'i yod pa yang mi rung ste rgyu med pa can nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med par 'bras bu'i yod pa yang mi rung ste rgyu med pa can nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also not tenable that an effect exists without a cause, because it would follow that it would have no cause.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni tshad ma phyi ma'o //üîΩde'i yul can nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni tshad ma snga ma'i yul can nyid yin no zhes nye bar btags pa ste /
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni tshad ma phyi ma'o // de'i yul can nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni tshad ma snga ma'i yul can nyid yin no zhes nye bar btags pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the later valid knowledge.üîΩ‚ÄúIt is the object of that‚Äù means that it is the object of the earlier valid knowledge.

original: 'bras bu la yang rgyu nye bar btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu la yang rgyu nye bar btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the earlier valid knowledge is designated as the cause and the later valid knowledge is designated as the effect.

original: gal te 'on kyang tshad ma phyi ma 'jug par byed pas tshad ma snga ma ni tshad ma phyi ma 'jug pa'i dus nyid na de tshad ma yin gyi sngar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'on kyang tshad ma phyi ma 'jug par byed pas tshad ma snga ma ni tshad ma phyi ma 'jug pa'i dus nyid na de tshad ma yin gyi sngar ni ma yin no //
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúHowever, because the later valid knowledge is what engages, the earlier valid knowledge is valid at the time of the engagement of the later valid knowledge, but it is not earlier,‚Äù

original: med par de'i ngo bo byed pa nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: med par de'i ngo bo byed pa nus pa ma yin no //
translated: then it is not tenable that it is the cause of that, because it is not possible for something that does not exist to perform the action of being a cause.

original: gzhon nu ma len gyis /üîΩtshad ma thams cad rang nyid kyis //
analyzed: gzhon nu ma len gyis / tshad ma thams cad rang nyid kyis //
translated: KumƒÅrila says:üîΩAll valid knowledge is apprehended

original: tshad ma nyid ces gzung ba yin //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid ces gzung ba yin //
translated: as valid knowledge by itself.

original: rang nyid nus pa med na ni //
analyzed: rang nyid nus pa med na ni //
translated: If it is not able to do so by itself,

original: gzhan gyis byed par mi nus so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis byed par mi nus so //
translated: it cannot do so by the other.

original: zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it says,

original: de'i phyir de bas na zhes bya ba 'di smos te gang gi phyir tshad ma snga ma'i yul med par tshad ma phyi ma'i yul mi srid pa de bas na sngar dngos po grub pa'i phyir te don byed pa'i yul can gyi shes pa las sngar yang ngoüîΩ// dang po nyid tshad ma yin te don byed pa'i yul can gyi shes pa phyi ma'i rgyur gyur pa dang po'i shes pa yang tshad ma yin te de yang dngos po'i @76a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bas na zhes bya ba 'di smos te gang gi phyir tshad ma snga ma'i yul med par tshad ma phyi ma'i yul mi srid pa de bas na sngar dngos po grub pa'i phyir te don byed pa'i yul can gyi shes pa las sngar yang ngo // dang po nyid tshad ma yin te don byed pa'i yul can gyi shes pa phyi ma'i rgyur gyur pa dang po'i shes pa yang tshad ma yin te de yang dngos po'i @76a * //
translated: Therefore, prior to the establishment of a thing, that is, prior to a consciousness that has an object that performs a function,

original: yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the first consciousness is valid knowledge, because the first consciousness that is the cause of a later consciousness that has an object that performs a function is valid knowledge, and that is because it has an object that is a thing.

original: de lta ma yin na ni de dngos po med pa'i yul can yin na de lta bur gyur pa'i shes pa phyi ma'i rgyu nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni de dngos po med pa'i yul can yin na de lta bur gyur pa'i shes pa phyi ma'i rgyu nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, if it had an object that is not a thing, it would not be the cause of a later consciousness that is like it.

original: de nyid ni de las don byed pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te de las zhes bya ba dang po'i shes pa nyid las te /
analyzed: de nyid ni de las don byed pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te de las zhes bya ba dang po'i shes pa nyid las te /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúBecause it engages in the performance of a function from that,‚Äù that is, from the first consciousness.

original: dang po'i shes pa ni don byed pa'i yul can gyi shes pa phyi ma'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dang po'i shes pa ni don byed pa'i yul can gyi shes pa phyi ma'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the first consciousness is the cause of the subsequent consciousness that has an object that is a functioning thing.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad du shes pa ni rang gi rgyu dag las skyes pa na tshad ma'i rang bzhin can nyid du skye bar 'gyur te /

original: de yang blang bar byed pa dang dor bar bya ba dag la len pa dang dor ba'i mtshan nyid can yin no //
analyzed: de yang blang bar byed pa dang dor bar bya ba dag la len pa dang dor ba'i mtshan nyid can yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is the characteristic of taking up and rejecting in regard to what is to be taken up and what is to be rejected.

original: chod pa med pa zhes bya ba ni gang tshad ma tsam la rag lus pa yin gyi rgyu gzhan gyis ni chod pa ma yin te dper na gzhal bya rtogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: chod pa med pa zhes bya ba ni gang tshad ma tsam la rag lus pa yin gyi rgyu gzhan gyis ni chod pa ma yin te dper na gzhal bya rtogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: ‚Äú Unobstructed‚Äù means that which depends only on the valid cognition, but is not obstructed by another cause, for example, the understanding of the object to be comprehended.

original: de yang khyad par can zhes brjod de gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba ni khyad par yin la des spyod pa'i phyir khyad par can no //
analyzed: de yang khyad par can zhes brjod de gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba ni khyad par yin la des spyod pa'i phyir khyad par can no //
translated: Moreover, it is called ‚Äúdistinguished‚Äù because it is necessarily the case that the object to be comprehended is distinguished by it, and it is distinguished because it is engaged by that.

original: tshad ma yod na gdon mi za bar gzhal bya rtogs par 'gyur te tshad ma las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma yod na gdon mi za bar gzhal bya rtogs par 'gyur te tshad ma las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When there is valid cognition, the object to be comprehended is necessarily understood, because it is not different from the valid cognition.

original: chod pa'i 'bras bu ni ma yin te gags byed pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chod pa'i 'bras bu ni ma yin te gags byed pa srid pa'i phyir ro //

original: de la chod pa'i 'bras bu shes pas blang bar bya ba'i don shes nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de la chod pa'i 'bras bu shes pas blang bar bya ba'i don shes nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: With regard to that, the result of a completed action is explained by ‚Äúhaving understood the object to be taken up by the knowledge of the result of a completed action. ‚Äù

original: dbang po la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras ni don dang bdag dang yid dang de dag phrad par yongs su gzung ngo //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras ni don dang bdag dang yid dang de dag phrad par yongs su gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in ‚Äúsense faculty and so on‚Äù includes the object, self, mind, and the contact of those.

original: de yod pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni dbang po la sogs pa yod pa tsam ltos pa med pa'i yul can gyi rtogs pas so //
analyzed: de yod pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni dbang po la sogs pa yod pa tsam ltos pa med pa'i yul can gyi rtogs pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy its mere presence‚Äù means by the mere presence of the sense faculty and so on, without dependence on the object.

original: de bas na rtag tu 'jug par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: de bas na rtag tu 'jug par 'gyur ro /
translated: Therefore it always engages.

original: zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: zhes bya bar dgongs so //

original: ji ltar rigs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni blang bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba dor ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni blang bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba dor ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAs is appropriate‚Äù means that it is to be taken up or rejected as is appropriate.

original: bsam pa ni 'di dang 'di bya'o snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di dang 'di bya'o snyam du sems pa'o //

original: dbang po la sogs pa bsam pa sngon du gtong ba can 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa bsam pa sngon du gtong ba can 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The engagement of the sense faculty and so on is not preceded by intention.

original: de bas na dang po'i shes pa nyid 'jug pa'i rgyu yin gyi dbang po la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na dang po'i shes pa nyid 'jug pa'i rgyu yin gyi dbang po la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the first cognition itself is the cause of engagement, not the sense faculty and so on.

original: bsam pa dang yul der 'gro ba la sogs pa bdag kyang 'jug par byed pa dag ma yin nam /
analyzed: bsam pa dang yul der 'gro ba la sogs pa bdag kyang 'jug par byed pa dag ma yin nam /
translated: But don‚Äôt intention, the mind‚Äôs movement toward the object, and so on also cause engagement?

original: bden te de lta na yang de las gzhan du gyur pa tshad ma de las gzhan pa de'i stobs las byung ba can te /
analyzed: bden te de lta na yang de las gzhan du gyur pa tshad ma de las gzhan pa de'i stobs las byung ba can te /
translated: That is true, but they are not different from the first cognition, because they arise from the power of that valid knowledge.

original: tshad ma'i stobs las skye ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma'i stobs las skye ba nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: de bas na de ni dang po'i 'jug pa'i yan lag ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de ni dang po'i 'jug pa'i yan lag ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not a limb of the first engagement.

original: tshad mas mthong ba'i don gyi yul can de dag ni de'i yul can dag yin no //
analyzed: tshad mas mthong ba'i don gyi yul can de dag ni de'i yul can dag yin no //

original: de bas na don ma rtogs pa nyid kyi rtogs pa po nyid kyang ma yin pa'i phyir dang po'i shes pa de nyid tshad ma yin te dang po 'jug par byed pa'i @78a * //
analyzed: de bas na don ma rtogs pa nyid kyi rtogs pa po nyid kyang ma yin pa'i phyir dang po'i shes pa de nyid tshad ma yin te dang po 'jug par byed pa'i @78a * //
translated: Therefore, because the cognizer does not even cognize the object, that first cognition is valid knowledge, because it is the limb of the first engagement,

original: yan lag nyid yin pa'i phyir don ma rtogs pa nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag nyid yin pa'i phyir don ma rtogs pa nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //

original: des na blo ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: des na blo ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

original: de zhes bya ba ni blo yul dang 'dra ba nyid do //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni blo yul dang 'dra ba nyid do //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the cognition being like the object.

original: 'di ni sngon po'i shes pa yin la 'di ni ser po'i shes pa yin no zhes bya ba ni don so so la tha dad par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni sngon po'i shes pa yin la 'di ni ser po'i shes pa yin no zhes bya ba ni don so so la tha dad par byed pa yin no //

original: nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid tha dad pa med du zin kyang zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid du blo yul so so la yul dang 'dra ba nyid las gzhan du tha dad pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid tha dad pa med du zin kyang zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid du blo yul so so la yul dang 'dra ba nyid las gzhan du tha dad pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: ‚Äú Even though there is no difference in the nature of the experience‚Äù means that the cognition is like the individual objects in the nature of the experience, and there is no difference other than that.

original: 'bras bu 'di zhes bya ba ni yul rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'di zhes bya ba ni yul rtogs pa'o //

original: de yod na yang 'ga' zhig gi tshe zhes bya ba ni zlog pa rjod par byed pa'o //üîΩde'i zhes bya ba ni yul dang 'dra ba nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: de yod na yang 'ga' zhig gi tshe zhes bya ba ni zlog pa rjod par byed pa'o // de'i zhes bya ba ni yul dang 'dra ba nyid kyi'o //
translated: ‚Äú Even when that exists, sometimes‚Äù is the statement of the reversal.üîΩ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to being like the object.

original: de ni yul rtogs pa ni'o //
analyzed: de ni yul rtogs pa ni'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the understanding of the object.

original: chod pa med pa de'i phyir gzhan la ltos pa med pa can yul dang 'dra ba nyid 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa'i rten yin no //
analyzed: chod pa med pa de'i phyir gzhan la ltos pa med pa can yul dang 'dra ba nyid 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa'i rten yin no //
translated: Because it is not interrupted, it is independent of anything else, and it is the basis for positing the effect, which is like the object.

original: brjod pa'i yul la zhes bya ba ni /

original: rig byed pa'i ngag gi yul la'o //
analyzed: rig byed pa'i ngag gi yul la'o //

original: grub pa'i sgra don tha dad par byas nas mngon par gsal ba'am skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par rtog par byed de gzhan las skye ba'i nges pa ni mngon par gsal ba'o //

analyzed: rtag par smra ba'i gzhung gis 'dir dper byas pa yin no //

analyzed: 'bras chan grub pa zhes bya bas ni skye ba zhes bya ba rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe establishment of the cooked rice‚Äù is understood as ‚Äúarising.‚Äù

analyzed: de ltar rnam par rtog bar bya ba dang / gang gi tshe khong nas mi 'byung ba de'i tshe yang rang nyid las tshad ma nyid yin no zhes brjod pa na ci nges pa'am skye ba zhes brjod par bya'o snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: then when it is analyzed in that way, and when it is not extracted, then when it is said, ‚ÄúIt is valid knowledge in itself,‚Äù it must be said that it is ascertained or produced.

original: de la gal te sgra grub pa skye ba'i brjod pa yin pa de'i tshe tshad ma'i rgyu gzhan las skye ba spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: de la gal te sgra grub pa skye ba'i brjod pa yin pa de'i tshe tshad ma'i rgyu gzhan las skye ba spangs pa yin te /
translated: In that regard, if the term ‚Äúestablished‚Äù is an expression of production, then it rejects that valid knowledge is produced from another cause.

analyzed: bdag nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid tshad ma skye bar brjod pa'i phyir ro //

original: shes pa skyes pa'i tshad ma'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i rgyu ma yin zhing ma skyes pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /

translated: he says, ‚ÄúFirst, it is not arisen,‚Äù and so on. The phrase ‚Äúin the states called arisen and non-arisen‚Äù is the second of the seven

analyzed: tshad ma dang der snang bdag skye ba'i dus na khyad par nges par gzung ba med de zhes bya ba ni goms pa med pa zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: cases. ‚Äú When valid knowledge and its appearance are arisen, there is no ascertainment of a distinction‚Äù should be understood as ‚Äúwhen there is no habituation.‚Äù

translated: The statement ‚Äúthe example is not established‚Äù in this s≈´tra is explained as ‚Äúthe example is empty of the probandum.‚Äù

analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid rnam par 'byed par byed do //
translated: He analyzes that very [example] with ‚Äúby a person who is like this . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i skyes bus zhes bya ba ni gzhan phan 'dogs par byed pa la ltos pa med pa la sogs pa dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i skyes bus zhes bya ba ni gzhan phan 'dogs par byed pa la ltos pa med pa la sogs pa dang ldan pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy a person who is like this‚Äù means by one who is independent of others and so on.

original: skyes bu mi rtag pas byin gyis brlabs pa'i ste'u la sogs pa rnams kyi 'jug pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //üîΩdes ni gang sdod nas 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba de'i dpe gang yin pa de la bsgrub par bya bas stong pa nyid bshad do //
analyzed: skyes bu mi rtag pas byin gyis brlabs pa'i ste'u la sogs pa rnams kyi 'jug pa mthong ba'i phyir ro // des ni gang sdod nas 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba de'i dpe gang yin pa de la bsgrub par bya bas stong pa nyid bshad do //
translated: Because the activity of a pestle and so on that is empowered by a person who is impermanent is seen.üîΩHe explains that the example of the syllogism ‚Äúthe activity of a pestle and so on is not due to its own nature because it is observed to occur sometimes and not to occur at other times‚Äù is empty of the probandum.

original: de bzhin du gzhal yas kyang la sogs pa grub pa ni de lta bur gyur pa'i skyes bus byin gyis brlabs pa'i dbang gis ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhal yas kyang la sogs pa grub pa ni de lta bur gyur pa'i skyes bus byin gyis brlabs pa'i dbang gis ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Similarly, ‚Äúthe establishment of a pot and so on is not due to the power of being empowered by a person who is like this‚Äù should be applied.

original: 'dis ni sbyor ba bar ma'i dpe bsgrub par bya bas stong pa nyid bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni sbyor ba bar ma'i dpe bsgrub par bya bas stong pa nyid bshad do //
translated: This explains the emptiness of the example by the probandum in the case of the middle application.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i skyes bus byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba 'di la yang ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i skyes bus byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba 'di la yang ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: And it is not so in the case of the consecration, etc. of a person who is such.

original: 'dis ni sbyor ba gsum pa'i dpe bsgrub par bya bas stong pa nyid bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni sbyor ba gsum pa'i dpe bsgrub par bya bas stong pa nyid bshad do //
translated: This explains the emptiness of the example by the probandum in the case of the third application.

original: de ltar re zhig skyes bu gzhan gyi phan 'dogs pa la ltos pa med pa skyes bu'i blo sngon du song ba can nyid kyis dpe ma grub pa brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig skyes bu gzhan gyi phan 'dogs pa la ltos pa med pa skyes bu'i blo sngon du song ba can nyid kyis dpe ma grub pa brjod nas /
translated: Thus, first of all, he shows that the example is not established because it presupposes the cognition of a person who is not dependent on the help of another.

original: da ni skyes bu gcig gi khyad par gyi blo sngon du song ba can nyid kyi ni thams cad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te thams cad du ste'u la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: da ni skyes bu gcig gi khyad par gyi blo sngon du song ba can nyid kyi ni thams cad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te thams cad du ste'u la sogs pa la'o //
translated: Now, in the case of the presupposition of the cognition of a single person, he says, in all cases, etc. In all cases, i.e., in the case of the adze, etc.

original: @82b de bas na skyes bu gcig gi blo sngon du song ba can nyid ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: @82b de bas na skyes bu gcig gi blo sngon du song ba can nyid ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the presupposition of the cognition of a single person is not established.

original: ci ste skyes bu du ma nye ba sbyor ba nyid yin du zin kyang de la gcig ni gtso bo nyid yin te de nyid dbyug tu 'gyur bar 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste skyes bu du ma nye ba sbyor ba nyid yin du zin kyang de la gcig ni gtso bo nyid yin te de nyid dbyug tu 'gyur bar 'dod do zhe na /
translated: But if, although many beings are engaged, one of them is the principal one, and he alone is the creator,

original: nye bar sbyor ba dag la yang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nye bar sbyor ba dag la yang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúEven in regard to the engaged ones,‚Äù

original: gnas skabs gzhan thob pa gags bya bar mi nus pa can thams cad ni gtso bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan thob pa gags bya bar mi nus pa can thams cad ni gtso bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all of them, who have attained another state, are unable to obstruct, are principal ones.

original: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir thams cad de la nye bar sbyor ba na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir thams cad de la nye bar sbyor ba na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to make that clear, he says, ‚ÄúWhen all are engaged in that,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'bras bu de 'grub par bya ba'i phyir nye bar sbyor ba ni de la nye bar sbyor ba na'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu de 'grub par bya ba'i phyir nye bar sbyor ba ni de la nye bar sbyor ba na'o //
translated: When all are engaged in that, in order to accomplish that effect,

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi skyes bu de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug gis so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi skyes bu de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug gis so //
translated: ‚Äúby that very being of that kind,‚Äù by God.

original: de ltar na dbang phyug kyang sdod cing sdod nas lus la sogs pa la 'jug par byed na'o //
analyzed: de ltar na dbang phyug kyang sdod cing sdod nas lus la sogs pa la 'jug par byed na'o //
translated: Thus, God also remains, and having remained, he engages in the body and so on.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni byed pa dang gnas yongs su gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni byed pa dang gnas yongs su gzung ngo //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include the agent and the experiencer.

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi skyes bu gzhan gyis byin gyis brlabs pa zhes bya ba ni rang nyid kyis ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi skyes bu gzhan gyis byin gyis brlabs pa zhes bya ba ni rang nyid kyis ma nges pa yin no //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe other person who is the consecrator of that sort‚Äù is not definite in itself.

original: ci ste de la yang byin gyis rlob pa po 'dod na byin gyis rlob pa po gang yin pa des ma nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste de la yang byin gyis rlob pa po 'dod na byin gyis rlob pa po gang yin pa des ma nges pa ma yin no //
translated: If you assert that there is a consecrator of that sort, then the consecrator is not definite.

original: de la yang byin gyis rlob pa po gzhan khas len na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang byin gyis rlob pa po gzhan khas len na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you accept that there is another consecrator of that sort, then there is the fault of an infinite regress.

original: de ltar re zhig sdod nas 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid du bshad nas don byed par nus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ma nges pa nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir thug pa med pa'i skyon yod pa nyid kyi phyir
analyzed: de ltar re zhig sdod nas 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid du bshad nas don byed par nus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ma nges pa nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir thug pa med pa'i skyon yod pa nyid kyi phyir
translated: Thus, having explained that the reason ‚Äúbecause it exists‚Äù is indefinite, he says that the reason ‚Äúbecause it is able to perform a function‚Äù is indefinite because there is the fault of an infinite regress.

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi skyes bus byin gyis rlob pa ste dbang phyug gis don gyi bya ba byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di yang rang nyid kyis ma nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi skyes bus byin gyis rlob pa ste dbang phyug gis don gyi bya ba byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di yang rang nyid kyis ma nges pa ma yin no //
translated: The reason that ‚Äúa person of such a kind does not perform the function of the object by the blessing, i.e., by the almighty‚Äù is not unestablished by itself.

original: de ni sdod nas 'jug par byed pa nyid kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dbang phyug 'di ni rtag tu 'jug pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni sdod nas 'jug par byed pa nyid kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dbang phyug 'di ni rtag tu 'jug pa nyid yin no //
translated: And this is not the case that ‚Äúhe does not act after having remained.‚Äù This almighty is just always active.

original: de bas na de la gtan tshigs 'jug pa nyid yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gang gis na ma nges pa ma yin snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na de la gtan tshigs 'jug pa nyid yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gang gis na ma nges pa ma yin snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, since the reason is not present in that, it is not the case that it is unestablished.

original: de'i 'bras bu thams cad la zhes bya ba la rim bzhin du byed pa can nyid ma yin par khas len pa na cig car 'bras bu skyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu thams cad la zhes bya ba la rim bzhin du byed pa can nyid ma yin par khas len pa na cig car 'bras bu skyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is accepted that he is not the agent in a sequential manner, then he would produce the effect simultaneously.

original: gal te rtag par rim gyis byed pa nyid yin na yang ji ltar 'gyur zhe na nyes pa gzhan 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rtag par rim gyis byed pa nyid yin na yang ji ltar 'gyur zhe na nyes pa gzhan 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: If he is the agent in a sequential manner, then what is the problem?

original: rang bzhin nyams pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni thams cad du don byed pa khas mi len na dngos po nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //üîΩgzhan @83a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyams pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni thams cad du don byed pa khas mi len na dngos po nyid nyams par 'gyur ro // gzhan @83a * //
translated: Because of the degeneration of intrinsic reality. If one does not accept the performance of function everywhere, then intrinsic reality itself degenerates.

original: yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sdod nas 'jug pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sdod nas 'jug pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, etc. The reason, ‚Äúbecause of remaining and engaging,‚Äù etc., is unestablished.

original: khyab pa med pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid kyang yin no zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya bas sgrub par byed pa la khyab pa med pa'i phyir ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: khyab pa med pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid kyang yin no zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya bas sgrub par byed pa la khyab pa med pa'i phyir ma nges pa yin no //
translated: It is also uncertain because of the absence of pervasion. It is uncertain because the probandum does not pervade the proof.

original: sngar rang nyid kyi dang des ni rnam ba thams cad du ma nges par bstan to //
analyzed: sngar rang nyid kyi dang des ni rnam ba thams cad du ma nges par bstan to //
translated: Previously, he himself has shown it to be uncertain in every way.

original: sgo khang ni sgo'i bye brag go //
analyzed: sgo khang ni sgo'i bye brag go //
translated: A porch is a particular kind of door.

original: de'i byed pa ma mthong du zin kyang ste gang gis khang bzangs la sogs pa de byed pa ma mthong na yang ngo //
analyzed: de'i byed pa ma mthong du zin kyang ste gang gis khang bzangs la sogs pa de byed pa ma mthong na yang ngo //
translated: Even though one does not see its activity, i.e., even though one does not see the activity of that which makes the mansion, etc.,

original: gang las ri la sogs pa dag la de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi dbyibs yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir ma grub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang las ri la sogs pa dag la de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi dbyibs yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir ma grub pa nyid yin no //
translated: Since such a shape does not exist in a mountain, etc., therefore, it is not established.üîΩIn the same way, it should be said with regard to remaining, moving, etc.,

original: de skad du sdod nas 'jug pa la sogs pa dag la yang brjod par bya'i zhes bya ba ni ci 'dra ba'i sdod nas 'jug pa dang don byed par nus pa blo sngon du song ba can ci 'dra ba nyid gal te lus dang byed pa la sogsüîΩpa dag la yod par gyur na der 'gyur te /
analyzed: de skad du sdod nas 'jug pa la sogs pa dag la yang brjod par bya'i zhes bya ba ni ci 'dra ba'i sdod nas 'jug pa dang don byed par nus pa blo sngon du song ba can ci 'dra ba nyid gal te lus dang byed pa la sogs pa dag la yod par gyur na der 'gyur te /
translated: if a body, action, etc., were to have the same kind of remaining, moving, and the ability to perform a function that are preceded by cognition, then that would be so.

original: gang las yod pa ma yin zhe'o //
analyzed: gang las yod pa ma yin zhe'o //
translated: But since they do not exist, therefore, it is not established.üîΩWhat kind of establishment?

original: ci 'dra ba grub pa zhes bya ba ni bkod pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba 'chad par 'gyur ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: ci 'dra ba grub pa zhes bya ba ni bkod pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba 'chad par 'gyur ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: It is connected with what is to be explained, such as arrangement, etc.

original: dbyibs kyi khyad par la sogs pa tha dad pa la zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras ni sdod nas 'jug pa dang don byed par nus pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: dbyibs kyi khyad par la sogs pa tha dad pa la zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras ni sdod nas 'jug pa dang don byed par nus pa gzung ngo //
translated: The term ‚Äúetc.‚Äù in ‚Äúdifferent shapes, etc.‚Äù includes remaining, moving, and the ability to perform a function.

original: rdzas sngon po'i khyad par ni du ba'o //
analyzed: rdzas sngon po'i khyad par ni du ba'o //
translated: The particular substance of blue is smoke.

original: gang kho na me las skye ba'i chos de la gzhan dang thun mong ma yin pa'i chos ni sngon po nyid do //
analyzed: gang kho na me las skye ba'i chos de la gzhan dang thun mong ma yin pa'i chos ni sngon po nyid do //
translated: That which is the quality of fire is blue, which is not shared with anything else.

original: de bas na spyi de 'dra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas khyab pa med pa'i phyir dang gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid kyang yin no zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de mjug sdud par byed do //
analyzed: de bas na spyi de 'dra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas khyab pa med pa'i phyir dang gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid kyang yin no zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de mjug sdud par byed do //
translated: Therefore, he concludes that the reason is inconclusive, since the pervasion is not established, as stated in the passage beginning with ‚ÄúA universal is said to be . . .‚Äù

original: ci ste yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ma grub pa nyid bstan to ;
analyzed: ci ste yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ma grub pa nyid bstan to ;
translated: If, on the other hand, the opponent . . .

original: / dbyibs kyi khyad par de nyid ces bya ba ni khang bzangs la sogs pa skyes bus byas pa nyid du grags pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: / dbyibs kyi khyad par de nyid ces bya ba ni khang bzangs la sogs pa skyes bus byas pa nyid du grags pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat very distinctive shape‚Äù refers to the shape of a mansion, etc., which is well known to be produced by a person.

original: de'i 'bras bu nyid du zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i 'bras bu nyid du'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu nyid du zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i 'bras bu nyid du'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúas its effect‚Äù means as the effect of a person.

original: de bzhin du sdod nas 'jug pa la sogs pa'i khyad par ste'u la sogs pa dag la yang yin pa de ni ri bo la sogs pa dag la yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdod nas 'jug pa la sogs pa'i khyad par ste'u la sogs pa dag la yang yin pa de ni ri bo la sogs pa dag la yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Similarly, the distinctive shape of a plow, etc., which is produced by a person, is not found in a mountain, etc.

original: des byas zhes bya ba de'i bshad pa ni rdza mkhan gyis byas par ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des byas zhes bya ba de'i bshad pa ni rdza mkhan gyis byas par ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The explanation of ‚Äúthat which is produced by it‚Äù is ‚Äúthat which is produced by the potter.‚Äù

original: gal te spyi gtan tshigs su byas pa la khyad par kun du brtags pa'i phyir de ni 'bras bu dang mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'i ltag chod yin no //
analyzed: gal te spyi gtan tshigs su byas pa la khyad par kun du brtags pa'i phyir de ni 'bras bu dang mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'i ltag chod yin no //
translated: If the universal is the logical reason, then the particular is imagined, and that is a mere quibble, called ‚Äúthe same as the conclusion.‚Äù

original: gal @83b te bum pa'i byas pa nyid gtan tshigs yin na de ni sgra la yod pa ma yin te gzhan gyi chos gzhan la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal @83b te bum pa'i byas pa nyid gtan tshigs yin na de ni sgra la yod pa ma yin te gzhan gyi chos gzhan la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the productness of the pot is the logical reason, then it does not exist in the case of sound, because the property of one thing does not exist in another.

original: spyi gtan tshigs yin na zhes bya ba ni dbyibs la sogs pa tsam yin no //
analyzed: spyi gtan tshigs yin na zhes bya ba ni dbyibs la sogs pa tsam yin no //
translated: If the universal is the logical reason, then it is merely the universal of shape.

original: khyad par gtan tshigs yin na ni ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: khyad par gtan tshigs yin na ni ma grub pa yin no //
translated: If the particular is the logical reason, then it is unestablished.

original: rigs kyi khyad par ni rdzas kyi bye brag go //
analyzed: rigs kyi khyad par ni rdzas kyi bye brag go //
translated: The particular of the class is a particular substance.

original: rigs kyi spyi bzung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dbyibs kyi spyi gzung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩngag la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: rigs kyi spyi bzung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dbyibs kyi spyi gzung ba'i phyir ro // ngag la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni //
translated: Because the universal of the class is taken as the object, the universal of shape is taken as the object.üîΩSpeech, etc.

original: ngag phyogs pa dang 'od zer dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ngag phyogs pa dang 'od zer dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Speech, direction, light, etc.

original: ba lang nyid kyi phyir ni ba lang gi sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ba lang nyid kyi phyir ni ba lang gi sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of being a cow, it is the object of expression of the word cow.

original: de thams cad kyis ni ma grub pa nyid dang ma nges pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni khyad par gtan tshigs yin na ma grub pa dang spyi yin na ma nges pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: de thams cad kyis ni ma grub pa nyid dang ma nges pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni khyad par gtan tshigs yin na ma grub pa dang spyi yin na ma nges pa nyid du'o //
translated: All of those are called unestablished and indefinite, respectively, when the reason is a specific property and when it is a general property.

original: ser skya la sogs kyi zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras ni 'ug pa pa gzung ngo //üîΩsems med sogs zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras ni bde ba la sogs pa ni nang gi nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gzung ngo //
analyzed: ser skya la sogs kyi zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras ni 'ug pa pa gzung ngo // sems med sogs zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras ni bde ba la sogs pa ni nang gi nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚ÄúKapila and so on‚Äù includes the owl followers.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúmindless and so on‚Äù includes the argument that pleasure and so on are not internal because they are not minds.

original: blo dang bde ba ka sogs pa'i chos can ni mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs las sems med pa la sogs pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i dpyad pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: blo dang bde ba ka sogs pa'i chos can ni mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs las sems med pa la sogs pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i dpyad pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúmind, pleasure, and so on‚Äù is connected to the analysis of the reason ‚Äúimpermanence and so on‚Äù in the proof that ‚Äúmindless things and so on are not internal.‚Äù

original: dper na blo dang bde ba la sogs pa ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir dang / skye ba dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir sems med pa dang nang gi nyid ma yin te gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na blo dang bde ba la sogs pa ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir dang / skye ba dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir sems med pa dang nang gi nyid ma yin te gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, mind, pleasure, etc. are not non-mental, like form, etc., because they are impermanent and because they possess origination.

original: yang gi sgra ni rim pa gzhan dus byar ro zhes bya ba mi rtag pa la sogs pa phyir yang zhes bya ba 'di'i yang gi sgra rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba ni sems dang ldan pa yang zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni rim pa gzhan dus byar ro zhes bya ba mi rtag pa la sogs pa phyir yang zhes bya ba 'di'i yang gi sgra rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba ni sems dang ldan pa yang zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is to be construed in two ways: ‚Äúimpermanence, etc. also‚Äù and ‚Äúmind also.‚Äù

original: shun lpags thams cad bshus na 'chi ba'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir zhes bya ba 'di las shing rnams sems dang ldan par bsgrub par bya ba gang yin pa de yang dpyad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don to //
analyzed: shun lpags thams cad bshus na 'chi ba'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir zhes bya ba 'di las shing rnams sems dang ldan par bsgrub par bya ba gang yin pa de yang dpyad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don to //
translated: The meaning of the sentence ‚Äúbecause it is a reason for death when all the bark is removed‚Äù is that the argument proving that trees possess mind is to be examined.

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
