analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i gnas skabs gnyi ga'i khyad par la yang ngo //
translated: The opposite of that is the definition of a permanent thing, such as God.

original: 'di ltar tshad ma nyid kyi sgrub par byed pa nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni thabs gang gi tshad ma nyid thob par 'gyur ba'i thabs de yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ltar tshad ma nyid kyi sgrub par byed pa nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni thabs gang gi tshad ma nyid thob par 'gyur ba'i thabs de yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, there is no proof of valid cognition itself. This means that there is no means by which one could obtain valid cognition.

original: rkang zha ni rkang pa zha ba can no //
analyzed: rkang zha ni rkang pa zha ba can no //
translated: A lame man is one who has a lame leg.

original: khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o zhes bya ba ni de'i sgrub par byed pa nan tan du byed pa yod pa la /
analyzed: khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o zhes bya ba ni de'i sgrub par byed pa nan tan du byed pa yod pa la /
translated: The observation of the contradiction of the pervader is as follows: When there is the practice of the proof of that,

original: de'i sgrub par byed pa nyid kyis khyab pa nyid kyi phyir de dang 'gal ba sgrub par byed pa med pa can dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i sgrub par byed pa nyid kyis khyab pa nyid kyi phyir de dang 'gal ba sgrub par byed pa med pa can dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is pervaded by the proof of that, the observation of the non-existence of the proof of that which is contradictory with it.

original: gcig la 'gal ba dag lhan cig gnas par thal ba ni 'gal ba sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi mi dmigs pa thams cad la bzlog pa na gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yin par blta bar bya'o //üîΩshes bya ma lus pa la khyab pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: gcig la 'gal ba dag lhan cig gnas par thal ba ni 'gal ba sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi mi dmigs pa thams cad la bzlog pa na gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yin par blta bar bya'o // shes bya ma lus pa la khyab pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i phyir ram /
translated: The consequence that contradictions would coexist in one thing is a valid refutation when the opposite of all non-apprehensions characterized by the establishment of contradictions is applied.

original: nan tan du bya ba'i don gyi yul can gyi ye shes dang ldan pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid yin na de la dang po la ni snyam sems pa'i tshad ma yod du zin kyang 'di tshad mar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di la 'dod pa ma yin gyi
analyzed: nan tan du bya ba'i don gyi yul can gyi ye shes dang ldan pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid yin na de la dang po la ni snyam sems pa'i tshad ma yod du zin kyang 'di tshad mar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di la 'dod pa ma yin gyi
translated: If it is valid cognition because it possesses the wisdom that pervades all objects of knowledge, or because it possesses the wisdom whose object is the meaning to be earnestly practiced, then in the first case, even if there is valid cognition of mere thought, it is not asserted that this becomes valid cognition.

original: 'on kyang gnyis pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gnyis pa kho na yin no //
translated: But in the second case, it is.

original: de bas na de nyid la snyam sems pa'i tshad ma bstan pa'i sgo nas gtan tshigs ma grub par bstan par 'dod pas /
analyzed: de bas na de nyid la snyam sems pa'i tshad ma bstan pa'i sgo nas gtan tshigs ma grub par bstan par 'dod pas /
translated: Therefore, in order to show that the reason is not established by the valid cognition of mere thought,

original: des bshad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: des bshad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says ‚Äúbecause it is explained by him,‚Äù and so on.

original: rtogs pa pos skyes bu'i don nan tan du bya ba ni bden pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa pos skyes bu'i don nan tan du bya ba ni bden pa bzhi'o //
translated: The purpose of a person is the four noble truths.

original: de mkhyen pa can zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de mkhyen pa can zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The one who knows that is called ‚Äúthe knower of the purpose.‚Äù

original: nan tan du bya ba'i don mkhyen pa can te skyes bu'i'o //
analyzed: nan tan du bya ba'i don mkhyen pa can te skyes bu'i'o //
translated: The purpose of practice is the four noble truths. The one who knows that is called ‚Äúthe knower of the purpose.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi zhes bya ba ni sman pa 'di ni kho na'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi zhes bya ba ni sman pa 'di ni kho na'o //
translated: The other is the doctor.

original: nad med pa shes sam mi shes zhes de ltar sman pa'i shes pa tshol @87b bar mi byed do //
analyzed: nad med pa shes sam mi shes zhes de ltar sman pa'i shes pa tshol @87b bar mi byed do //
translated: One does not seek the doctor‚Äôs knowledge of whether or not he is cured.

original: rgyu mi dmigs pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang gi bshad pa nan tan du byed pa 'dod pa ni de'i yul can gyi shes pa tshol bar byed pa la rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mi dmigs pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang gi bshad pa nan tan du byed pa 'dod pa ni de'i yul can gyi shes pa tshol bar byed pa la rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nonobservation of a cause is as follows: One who desires to practice the explanation of a cause seeks the knowledge that has that as its object, because it is the cause.

original: rgyu mi dmigs pa thams cad la yang 'bras bu rgyu med pa can nyid du thal ba ni bzlog na gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu mi dmigs pa thams cad la yang 'bras bu rgyu med pa can nyid du thal ba ni bzlog na gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yin no //
translated: In all cases of the nonobservation of a cause, the consequence is that the effect would be without a cause. The valid knowledge that contradicts that is as follows.

original: de dang rjes su mthun pa ni sdug bsngal zhi ba'i thabs dang rjes su mthun par ston pa'o //
analyzed: de dang rjes su mthun pa ni sdug bsngal zhi ba'i thabs dang rjes su mthun par ston pa'o //
translated: The teaching that is in accord with that is the teaching that is in accord with the method for the pacification of suffering.

original: ston pa po gang las zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa po gang las so //
analyzed: ston pa po gang las zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa po gang las so //
translated: From whom? From the teacher.

original: de'i yul can gyi ye shes zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal zhi ba'i thabs su gyur pa'i yul can no //
analyzed: de'i yul can gyi ye shes zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal zhi ba'i thabs su gyur pa'i yul can no //
translated: The knowledge of that is the knowledge of the means of the pacification of suffering.

original: de yang yod pa tsam du btsal bar bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang yod pa tsam du btsal bar bya ba yin gyi /
translated: That is to be sought as mere existence,

original: skyes bu so sor nges pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu so sor nges pas ni ma yin te /
translated: not as a particular person,

original: de ni shes pa mi rung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni shes pa mi rung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because that is not suitable as knowledge.

original: de skad du yang bstan bcos mdzad pa nyid kyis gzhan dag tu skyes bu'i rtag pa la 'jug pa na mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de skad du yang bstan bcos mdzad pa nyid kyis gzhan dag tu skyes bu'i rtag pa la 'jug pa na mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
translated: The author of the treatise himself says elsewhere, ‚ÄúIf a person is engaged in permanence, he will become one who has the view of permanence.‚Äù

original: dam bcas par byed pas na dam bca' ba ste /üîΩbsgrub par bya ba yin gyi bsgrub par bya ba 'chad pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dam bcas par byed pas na dam bca' ba ste / bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi bsgrub par bya ba 'chad pa ni ma yin te /
translated: A thesis is that which is to be asserted,üîΩnot that which is to be explained, because it is not the object of proof.

original: de ni sgrub par byed pa'i dus na shin tu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sgrub par byed pa'i dus na shin tu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not the object of proof, because it does not exist at the time of the proof.

original: bsgrub bya ru gyur ba'i ye shes rnams dpyad bya'i zhes bya ba 'di 'dir dam bca' bar 'dod do //
analyzed: bsgrub bya ru gyur ba'i ye shes rnams dpyad bya'i zhes bya ba 'di 'dir dam bca' bar 'dod do //
translated: The knowledge that is to be proven is the object of investigation. This is what is asserted as the thesis here.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i yul can ma yin pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang /üîΩde'i srin grangs ni yongs mkhyen pa ;
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i yul can ma yin pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang / de'i srin grangs ni yongs mkhyen pa ;
translated: This is also refuted by the following verse:üîΩThe Omniscient One has declared

original: / kho bo'i gang la nyer mkho min //
analyzed: / kho bo'i gang la nyer mkho min //
translated: that it is not necessary for me to know the number of his lice.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i cha 'dis dgag par bya ba ni dam bca' ba gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i cha 'dis dgag par bya ba ni dam bca' ba gnyis pa yin no //
translated: The second proposition is to be refuted by this part of the verse.

original: 'dir ni 'grel pa mdzad pas /
analyzed: 'dir ni 'grel pa mdzad pas /
translated: Here the Commentary explains:

original: thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir bshad pa yin no //
translated: because of the consequence.

original: de ltar na /üîΩde yin grangs ni yongs mkhyen pa //
analyzed: de ltar na / de yin grangs ni yongs mkhyen pa //
translated: Thus,

original: zhes bya ba'i don 'chad pa na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don 'chad pa na /
translated: when explaining the meaning of the verse:üîΩThe Omniscient One has declaredüîΩthat it is not necessary for me to know the number of his lice,

original: dam bca' ba gnyis pa'o zhes smos so //
analyzed: dam bca' ba gnyis pa'o zhes smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe second proposition.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir dam bca' ba gnyis la tha dad par sbyor ba gang zhig sdug bsngal gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dam bca' ba gnyis la tha dad par sbyor ba gang zhig sdug bsngal gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, in order to distinguish the two propositions, he says, ‚ÄúBy what suffering?‚Äù and so on.

original: sdug bsngal de rab tu zhi ba'i thabs mkhyen pa gzhan gyi ye shes btsal bar bya ba yin gyi zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba gcig go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal de rab tu zhi ba'i thabs mkhyen pa gzhan gyi ye shes btsal bar bya ba yin gyi zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba gcig go //
translated: The second thing to be established is that the method of completely pacifying that suffering is to be sought in the wisdom of another.

original: de la nye bar mkho ba can ma yin pa'i ye shes ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de la nye bar mkho ba can ma yin pa'i ye shes ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second is: ‚ÄúIt is not a knowledge that is not needed.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is a natural inference.

original: de'i zhi ba'i thabs su gyur pa'i ye shes tshol ba nyid ni de'i sdug bsngal gyis gdungs pa tsam dang 'brel pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde la nye bar mkho ba can ma yin pa'i @88a * //
analyzed: de'i zhi ba'i thabs su gyur pa'i ye shes tshol ba nyid ni de'i sdug bsngal gyis gdungs pa tsam dang 'brel pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // de la nye bar mkho ba can ma yin pa'i @88a * //
translated: The seeking of the knowledge that is the means to its cessation is related to the mere being afflicted by its suffering.üîΩA knowledge that is not needed is not to be sought.

original: ye shes ni btsal bar bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa yin te /üîΩde la ltos na de'i yul can gyi ye shes 'tshol bar byed pa la /
analyzed: ye shes ni btsal bar bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa yin te / de la ltos na de'i yul can gyi ye shes 'tshol bar byed pa la /
translated: This is the second probandum.

original: de la nye bar mkho ba can nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: de la nye bar mkho ba can nyid kyis khyab pa yin la /
translated: In relation to that, the seeking of the knowledge that has it as its object is pervaded by its being needed.

original: de dang 'gal ba yang nye bar mkho ba can ma yin pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba yang nye bar mkho ba can ma yin pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: And the opposite of that is not being needed. This is the observation of the contradiction of the pervader.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung shes pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung shes pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: With regard to the knowledge of suffering and origin,

original: dor bya'i de kho na nyid rig par mdzad pa zhes bya ba 'dis sdug bsngal gyi bden pa shes pa dang / thabs dang bcas pa rig par mdzad pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni kun 'byung gi bden pa shes pa bstan to //
analyzed: dor bya'i de kho na nyid rig par mdzad pa zhes bya ba 'dis sdug bsngal gyi bden pa shes pa dang / thabs dang bcas pa rig par mdzad pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni kun 'byung gi bden pa shes pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase he has made known the reality of what is to be abandoned indicates his knowledge of the truth of suffering. The phrase he has made known the reality of the means indicates his knowledge of the truth of the origin.

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Form, feeling, conception, disposition, and consciousness.

original: 'bras bur gyur pa'i phung po lnga ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bur gyur pa'i phung po lnga ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
translated: The five aggregates that are the results are the truth of suffering.

original: de nyid rgyur gyur pa ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rgyur gyur pa ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
translated: The same aggregates that are the causes are the truth of the origin.

original: gtsor ni sred pa la kun 'byung gi bden par gsungs so //
analyzed: gtsor ni sred pa la kun 'byung gi bden par gsungs so //
translated: Craving is the principal cause of the origin of suffering.

original: de bzhin du blang bar bya ba'i de kho na nyid rig par mdzad pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'gog pa'i bden pa shes pa bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du blang bar bya ba'i de kho na nyid rig par mdzad pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'gog pa'i bden pa shes pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase he has made known the reality of what is to be adopted indicates his knowledge of the truth of the cessation.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'o //
translated: The truth of cessation is the abandonment of the afflictions such as passion.

original: thabs dang bcas pa'i rig par mdzad pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni lam gyi bden pa shes par bstan to //
analyzed: thabs dang bcas pa'i rig par mdzad pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni lam gyi bden pa shes par bstan to //
translated: This shows the knowledge of the truth of the path.

original: lam gyi bden pa shes pa yang bsgoms pa'i stobs las grub pa dri ma med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa shes pa yang bsgoms pa'i stobs las grub pa dri ma med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The knowledge of the truth of the path is also the stainless intuition that is accomplished through the power of meditation.üîΩThe establishment of that is accomplished through the power of meditation.

original: de'i sgrub par byed pa yod du zin kyang zhes bya ba de ni 'og nas bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i sgrub par byed pa yod du zin kyang zhes bya ba de ni 'og nas bstan par bya'o //
translated: The existence of its establishment is taught below.

original: gnod pa can cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin na zhes bya ba ni dbang po las 'das pa la gnod pa can med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod pa can cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin na zhes bya ba ni dbang po las 'das pa la gnod pa can med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is not the slightest bit of harm, because there is no harm to the suprasensory.

original: gzung bar bya ba'i tshig ces bya ba ni blang bar bya ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba'i tshig ces bya ba ni blang bar bya ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: The words to be grasped are the words to be accepted.

original: dud 'gro'i rigs mkha' la rgyu ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dud 'gro'i rigs mkha' la rgyu ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The animal species that move through the sky

original: bya rgod ma gtogs pa'i gzhan gang dag thag ring por mthong ba'am thos pa'o //
analyzed: bya rgod ma gtogs pa'i gzhan gang dag thag ring por mthong ba'am thos pa'o //
translated: are those other than vultures that are seen or heard from a distance.

original: rtogs byed ma ni mkha' 'gro ma'o //
analyzed: rtogs byed ma ni mkha' 'gro ma'o //
translated: The dakinis are the dakinis.

original: bya rgod smos pas ni nye bar mtshon pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: bya rgod smos pas ni nye bar mtshon pa'i don yin no //
translated: The mention of vultures is for the sake of illustration.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo la sogs pa dag la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo la sogs pa dag la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In regard to the wheel of the Dharma, etc.

original: ji ltar thugs su chud pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo ston par mdzad pa'i tshe'o //
analyzed: ji ltar thugs su chud pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo ston par mdzad pa'i tshe'o //
translated: When he teaches the wheel of the Dharma, in accordance with his understanding.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni mi 'jig pa la sogs pa rnam par 'jog par mdzad pa dag la'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni mi 'jig pa la sogs pa rnam par 'jog par mdzad pa dag la'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù refers to the establishment of non-destruction, etc.

original: thus rje yang ci zhig bzhed pa na'am /
analyzed: thus rje yang ci zhig bzhed pa na'am /
translated: What is the nature of his compassion?üîΩIn regard to what?

original: gang la'am / rnam pa gang gis sam /
analyzed: gang la'am / rnam pa gang gis sam /
translated: In what manner?

original: ci'i rang bzhin can du 'jug par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i rang bzhin can du 'jug par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is its nature?

original: phan btags pa'i lan la sogs pa la @88b ltos pa med pa can zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: phan btags pa'i lan la sogs pa la @88b ltos pa med pa can zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúit is independent of any reward for the help, etc.‚Äù

original: phan gdags pa byas pa dag las rnyed pa thob pa ni phan gdags pa'i lan no //
analyzed: phan gdags pa byas pa dag las rnyed pa thob pa ni phan gdags pa'i lan no //
translated: The reward for the help is the acquisition of wealth from those who have been helped.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni grags pa dang bsnyen bkur la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni grags pa dang bsnyen bkur la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù refers to fame and honor, etc.

original: de la ltos pa med pa de ltar na de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de la ltos pa med pa de ltar na de skad ces bya ste /
translated: It is independent of that, and so it is called that way.

original: sems can gyi don nyid bzhed pa na 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can gyi don nyid bzhed pa na 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is said that it functions when he wishes to help sentient beings.

original: mdza' bo dang dgra bo dag la rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba mi mda' ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mdza' bo dang dgra bo dag la rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba mi mda' ba'i phyir /
translated: Because he is not susceptible to attachment and aversion toward friends and enemies,

analyzed: khams gsum gyi khongs su gtogs pa'i sems can thams cad la snyoms pa'o //

analyzed: 'dis yul chen po can nyid du bstan pa'i phyir thugs rje chen po bshad do //

analyzed: rnam pa dang rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir shin tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate its aspects and essential nature, he says, ‚Äúextremely free of suffering,‚Äù and so on.

original: de yang mi skye ba'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir shin tu sdug bsngal dang bral ba gang yin pa de 'dod pa'i rnam pa zhe sdang med pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de yang mi skye ba'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir shin tu sdug bsngal dang bral ba gang yin pa de 'dod pa'i rnam pa zhe sdang med pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which is extremely free of suffering because it is not subject to origination is called ‚Äúnon-hatred,‚Äù which is the aspect of desire.

original: ji ltar de nyid goms pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de nyid goms pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it cultivated?

original: yon tan la chags pa las sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yon tan la chags pa las sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúfrom attachment to good qualities,‚Äù and so on.

analyzed: yon tan dag la 'ga' zhig chags pas goms par byed pa'i phyir te goms pa la 'bad rtsol dang ldan par 'gyur ro //

original: snying rje yang khyad par 'phags pa'i yon tan yin par dam pa rnams bzhed pa de bas na /
analyzed: snying rje yang khyad par 'phags pa'i yon tan yin par dam pa rnams bzhed pa de bas na /

analyzed: yon tan la chags pa las snying rje la 'jug par 'gyur ro //

original: sems can gyi khyad par las zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi khyad par las te /

analyzed: 'ga' zhig rigs gang yin pa de 'dra ba nyid kyang gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ro //

original: 'dis ni rgyu'i stobs bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni rgyu'i stobs bshad do //

original: rkyen gyi stobs ni gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

analyzed: snying rje goms pa can gyi byang chub sems dpa' dag gis byed pa ste /

original: snying rje la nges par sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: snying rje la nges par sbyar ba'o //

original: de bsnyen pa las sam zhes bya ba ni de dag gis nges par ma sbyar ba de lta na yang gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa rnams dang lhan cig gnas shing de bsnyen pa las de yon tan can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bsnyen pa las sam zhes bya ba ni de dag gis nges par ma sbyar ba de lta na yang gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa rnams dang lhan cig gnas shing de bsnyen pa las de yon tan can du 'gyur ro //
translated: From the practice of that means that even though they are not definitely applied to compassion, they become endowed with that quality from living with those who are engaged in the welfare of others and from practicing that.

original: bdag 'dod pa las zhes bya ba ni de dag gis byed pa'am bsnyen pa las ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: bdag 'dod pa las zhes bya ba ni de dag gis byed pa'am bsnyen pa las ma yin mod kyi /

original: 'on kyang bdag nyid de snying rje 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag nyid de snying rje 'dod pa yin no //

original: yon tan la chags pa las zhes bya ba 'di las 'di la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: yon tan la chags pa las zhes bya ba 'di las 'di la khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between this and the one from attachment to virtue?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /

original: der ni yon tan yin no zhes shes nas 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: der ni yon tan yin no zhes shes nas 'jug pa yin la /
translated: There, it is known that virtue is the cause, and one engages in it.

original: 'dir ni 'bras bu la ltos pa med pa de'i ngang tshul nyid @89a * //üîΩkyis de snying rje 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'bras bu la ltos pa med pa de'i ngang tshul nyid @89a * // kyis de snying rje 'dod pa yin no //

analyzed: rgyu de rnams kyis snying rje goms par byas nas shi nas kyang ngo //

analyzed: mthar phyin pa ni 'phel ba'i mthar phyin pa'o //

original: gal te blo ni lus rten phyir //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i phyogs snga ma 'god par byed do //

analyzed: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung //

original: de dag las sems ni myos pa'i nus pa bzhin no zhes smra'o //
analyzed: de dag las sems ni myos pa'i nus pa bzhin no zhes smra'o //

original: gzhung gsum po 'di nyid blo ni lus kyi yon tan yin pa de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: gzhung gsum po 'di nyid blo ni lus kyi yon tan yin pa de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed do //
translated: This third position is explained by the statement ‚ÄúThe mind is a quality of the body‚Äù and so on.

original: blo ni yon tan nyid dang / 'bras bu nyid dang nus pa nyid la ltos nas go rims bzhin du yon tan can gyi lus sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa tha snyad du byed pa yin no //

analyzed: blo'i mtshan nyid can gyi chos sam zhes bya ba ni yon tan no //

original: de skad du brjod pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de skad du brjod pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin this way‚Äù refers toüîΩthe Lokayatas‚Äô statement:

original: gal te blo ni lus rten phyir //
analyzed: gal te blo ni lus rten phyir //

original: goms pa grub pa med ce na //
analyzed: goms pa grub pa med ce na //

translated: If there were transformation, it would follow, absurdly, that living beings would not be different.

original: 'o na ji ltar 'dod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar 'dod ce na /

original: 'gal ba'i rkyen las zhes bya ba ni dug dang mtshon bya la sogs pa'i rgyu las so //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i rkyen las zhes bya ba ni dug dang mtshon bya la sogs pa'i rgyu las so //

analyzed: 'tsho ba'i gnas skabs las rnam pa gzhan du gyur ba ni 'chi ba'i tha snyad du rung ba'o //

analyzed: yang rkyen ji lta bu bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'dus byas kyi rgyun gyis rgyun mi 'chad par ston par @89b byed do //

original: rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni sems gang gis rjes su mthun par sad pa'i rkyen gang yin pa'o / rab tu sad pa'i rkyen de yang rnam pa gnyis te /

analyzed: gang dag la bya ba'i sems nyid mngon du gyur pa yod pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //

original: de la bya ba'i sems pa can gyi don dang pos ni yongs su gyur pa dang / bya ba'i don gyi sems gnyis pas ni yongs su gyur pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: de la bya ba'i sems pa can gyi don dang pos ni yongs su gyur pa dang / bya ba'i don gyi sems gnyis pas ni yongs su gyur pa thob pa'o //
translated: In this regard, by the first meaning of the mind that is the agent of action, there is transformation; by the second meaning of the mind that is the agent of action, there is the attainment of transformation.

original: ji ltar goms pa nyid kyis yongs su gyur pa dag kyang zhes bya ba'i sngar gyur pa'i brtse ba dang blo la sogs pa dag la ci 'dra ba goms par byas pas 'dus byas pa'i khyad par dang ldan par 'gyur te /
